spell.name: Acid Splash
entries: You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} acid damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Animate Instrument
entries: You may touch a nonmagical tool, instrument, or utensil that you possess, bringing it to life under your command. It has a movement speed of 10 feet and if it takes any damage, the instrument is destroyed and the spell ends.

You can only have one animated at a time and it can only follow basic commands, such as following a creature, dusting a small area, stir the food, or playing a simple beat. You can mentally give it a new task it if it is within 10 feet of you. Once given an order, the instrument continues to follow it until the task is complete.
If you issue no commands, a musical instrument might tune itself or try some notes, a hammer might lightly tap some nails, while a broom might idly move around dust.
At 5th level, the spell's duration increase to 10 minutes. At
11th level, you can have two instruments affected at a time. At
17th level, you can have three instruments affected at a time and the range at which you can command and control the instruments increase to 30 feet.

spell.name: Bar the Way

components.m: a stick of chalk and a nail

entries: By drawing a magic circle upon it, you magically seal one hinged or sliding mechanism shut, such as a door, window, gate, chest, drawer, etc. The mechanism can still be opened as an action with an {@skill Athletics} check versus your spell save DC, or by destroying the mechanism as normal. Doing either dispels the effects of the spell.

At 5th level, the duration increases to 8 hours and you can ignore the material component. At 11th level, the duration increases to 10 days and you can ignore the verbal component. At 17th level, the spell lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Blade Bend
entries: You imbue your weapon with energy, making the material more malleable. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against each creature within the area of effect, which is a 5 foot cube within range, otherwise the spell fails. Your target does not gain the benefit of cover as long as that cover is made out of nonmagical material.
At 5th level, the area of the spell increases to two adjacent

5-foot cubes. At 11th level this increases to 3 cubes, and at 17th it increases to 4. Only the first target needs to be within 5 feet of you, but all affected cubes need to be adjacent to at least one other cube. You can only target a creature once with this spell per casting.

spell.name: Blade Ward
entries: You extent your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air.
Until the end of your turn, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks.

At 5th level, you can cast this spell on a creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At 11th level, you can ignore the verbal component of the spell. At 17th level, when you cast this spell on another creature, you also gain its benefits.

spell.name: Blessed Blade
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the weapon's range, otherwise the spell fails. When you do, you add a {@dice d4} to the attack roll. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects. This effect does not stack with the {@spell bless} spell.

This spell deals bonus damage when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, your weapon blazes briefly with holy power, causing the attack to deal an extra {@damage 1d10} radiant damage to the target. The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} at 11th level ({@dice 2d10}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d10}).

spell.name: Blightclaw
entries: You slash at a target with a claw of greenish-black energy at a target within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Blindspot
entries: Choose a creature within range, you make yourself appear unremarkable in their mind's eye. It must make Wisdom saving throw, on a failure it won't willingly target you with an attack or spell if it can target a different creature that is hostile towards it. If it targets you while affected by this spell, it takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Bloodletting
entries: You touch a creature and expend 1 hit point, opening a wound where you touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Bonding Vine
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become connected to you with a magical vine. A Large or smaller creature that you are connected with must make a Strength saving throw whenever they attempt to move to a point more than 20 feet away from you. A creature larger than you makes this save with advantage. On a failed save, their speed is reduced to zero until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, the vine snaps, and they are freed.
At 5th level, you can target a Huge or smaller creature. At

11th level, you can target one additional creature when casting this spell and can ignore the somatic component of the spell. At 17th level, you can target a Gargantuan or smaller creature as well as a third creature.

spell.name: Booming Blade
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the weapon's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves more than 5 feet before then, it immediately takes {@damage 1d6} thunder damage, and the spell ends.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} thunder damage to the target, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to {@dice 2d6}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@dice 2d6 / 3d6}) and 17th level

spell.name: Buffering Strike
entries: Your strikes allow you to infuse your weapon with protective energy, creating a small barrier between you and your enemies. Make a melee weapon attack against one creature within your weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. These hit points lasts until the start of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels.
At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to the target. The extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Cheerful Song
entries: You sing a happy little tune, bolstering the spirits of up to 3 allies within range. Affected creatures gain 1 temporary hit point, and can add a +1 bonus to their attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks made before the start of your next turn.
At 5th level, the range of this spell increase to 60 feet. At
11th level, you can target up to 4 allies and the temporary hit points increase by 1(2). At 17th level, the range of this spell increases to 90 feet and the temporary hit points increase by
2(4) and the bonus to attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks increase by 1(+2).

entries.name: Conceal
entries: By chanting and wrapping your hand around a nonmagical object weighing 2 pounds or less, the object is transported it to a tiny pocket dimension as your hand closes into a fist. As long as your hand is closed, the item remains in its pocket dimension, where it doesn't experience time. Only one object can be concealed at a time. If the caster is killed while an object is concealed, the concealed object is ejected into the Astral plane.

entries.name: Recall
entries: As a bonus action, you can open your fist. In an audible pop, the concealed object reappears in your hand.

At 5th level, you can target magical items and using recall is completely silent. At 11th level, you can use conceal as an action and you can conceal two items, one per hand. At 17th level, you can open your hands as normal and can decide when you want the item(s) to reappear.

spell.name: Concussive Chord
entries: You release a blast of sound with your voice (verbal component) or your instrument (somatic component). Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit the creature takes {@damage 1d10} thunder damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th ({@dice 4d10}).
This spell requires Verbal {@b OR} somatic components.

spell.name: Control Flames
entries: You choose a nonmagical flame that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You affect it in one of the following ways:
You instantaneously expand the flame 5 feet in one direction, provided that wood or other fuel is present in the new location.
You instantaneously extinguish the flames within the cube.
You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.
You cause simple shapes—such as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a location—to appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.
At 5th level, you can double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame. This change lasts for 1 hour.

At 11th level, you can have up to six non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss all such effects as a bonus action. Additionally, you can extinguish or change the area of light cast by any number of flames within range simultaneously. At 17th level, any flames you target for the effects of this spell may fit within a 10-foot cube, and the duration of non-instantaneous effects increases to 24 hours.

spell.name: Corpse Lunge
entries: You breathe a few moments of false life into a nearby corpse, briefly animating it to lunge at your foes. Choose a corpse within range; it can move up to 10 feet and either attempt a grapple, or make a single melee attack available to it in life against a target of your choice within 5 feet of it. The grapple is made using your spellcasting modifier + proficiency versus the targets Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) or Strength ({@skill Athletics}).
A corpse animated this way does not gain the benefits of any class features it had in life.
At 5th level, the corpse can make an opportunity attack. At
11th level, you may animate an additional corpse within range. At 17th level, you can have the corpse take any action available to it in life.

spell.name: Corrosive Pool
entries: You create a pool of bubbling acid on ground that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the liquid fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the pool's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} acid damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the pool's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The pool slowly corrodes objects in its area that aren't being worn or carried.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Dancing Lights

components.m: a bit of phosphours or wychwood, or a glowworm

entries: You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range or if you cast this spell again.

At 5th level, when creating lights with this spell, you can choose any number of them to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can also combine them into one glowing vaguely bestial form of Medium size. At 11th level, when you cast this spell, or as an action, you can attach one light to an object or creature within range. If the target is an unwilling creature, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the light safely attaches to the target. A light attached in this way moves with the target for the spell's duration, can no longer be moved by you, and it does not wink out if it exceeds the spell's range. At 17th level, you can create up to six lights, and you can combine them into one glowing vaguely humanoid or bestial form of Large size.

spell.name: Dazzle
entries: You create a bright flash of glittering lights around a target's face. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to look away or close its eyes. If it fails to do so, it takes {@damage 1d4} radiant damage and the first attack against it before the start of its turn has advantage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}) and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Desiccation
entries: You cause living things to wither as you draw the moisture from them. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage to the target. If the creature is a plant or comprised completely of water, it deals the maximum damage instead. Creatures such as undead and constructs, who doesn't require water to survive are immune to the effects of this spell.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Disorient
entries: You let out a shrill sound not unlike the clicking of a bat, focusing on a target within range. If the target can hear you they must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@dice 1d4} of psychic damage and if it is {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, it has disadvantage on the saving throw to maintain {@status concentration}.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}) and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Don/Doff
entries: You touch a set of armor, immediately donning it. If you are wearing the armor, you immediately doff it if there's an empty space within 5 feet.

At 5th level, you can choose for a willing target within 10 feet to be the target of the spell. At 11th level, you may cast this spell as a bonus action. At 17th level, you may cast this spell as a reaction.

spell.name: Douse
entries: You gesture, summoning a splash of saltwater to fall upon a creature or object within range. Flames are instantly quenched, and objects targeted by this spell cannot be ignited for at least one minute. If you target a creature, you can choose to have the saltwater be bone-chillingly cold. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 1d8} cold damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Druidcraft
entries: Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range:

You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so

entries.name: on
entries: This effect persists for 1 round.
You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
You reach out and touch the corpse of a creature. Over the course of the next minute, the corpse begins to rapidly deteriorate, either by decomposing, {@condition burning|HA:GS}, or similar effect.
You instantly light or snuff out a candle, torch, or a small campfire.
At 5th level, you gain a deeper control over the elements and can create one of the following effects within range:

A barrier against weather extends out from you in a 10- foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you and shielding the area from nonmagical snow, rain and wind. The barrier lasts for 1 hour.
You dim the flame of a candle, a torch, or a small campfire, halving its light radius.
You create a more potent sensory effect, like a roar of a tiger, rumble of thunder, or the acrid scent of smoke or {@condition burning|HA:GS} wood.
You touch a creature and remove any unnatural smell from its body or clothing.

At 11th level, when you use this spell to make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom, you can do so for all plants within range simultaneously. You can also reverse these effects by making seeds infertile, wilting flowers or drying out leaves. Additionally, when you use this spell to light or snuff out a flame, you may do so to any number of targets within range. At 17th level, when you use this spell to create a barrier against weather, you can influence the temperature and humidity within the sphere to feel comfortable to all creatures within it.

spell.name: Earth Blast
entries: You summon a small boulder and send it streaking toward a point you choose within range. Once the boulder reaches its destination or impacts a solid surface, it explodes. Each creature within 5 feet of the point where the boulder explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage on a failed saving throw.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Eidolic Chains
entries: A creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition grappled} by a set of ethereal chains you summon to bind your target. The target can repeat the saving throw at the start of their turn, and can use their action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check versus your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.
As a bonus action on your turn, you may move the {@condition grappled} creature up to 10 feet horizontally in any direction you choose, as long as you can see the destination.

At 5th level, you can move the target vertically and the range of the spell increases to 30 feet. At 11th level, you can move the target up to 20 feet when using your bonus action, and the range of the spell increases to 60 feet. At 17th level, you can target one additional creature and the targets repeats the saving throw at the end of their turn, and when you use your bonus action you can move both creatures up to 30 feet.

spell.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} force damage.

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

spell.name: Elemental Strike
entries: You infuse your weapon with raw energy, transmuting it into pure elemental energy. Make a melee weapon attack against one creature within your weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and the weapon's damage type becomes your choice of cold, fire, or lightning for that attack.
The spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels.

At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} damage to the target. The extra damage is the same as the weapon's chosen damage type, and increases by {@dice 1d10} at 11th level ({@dice 2d10}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d10}).

spell.name: Enhance Pain
entries: You momentarily heighten a creature's sense of pain. The target makes an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage the next time it takes damage before the spell ends. If the triggering damage is psychic damage, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} psychic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d8 / 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8 / 3d12}), and 17th level

spell.name: Fire Bolt
entries: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range.
Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Firelight Fly
entries: You touch a winged insect or your druidic focus (in which case, the former spring out into existence) and until the spell ends or if you cast it again, it sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the light bug to fly up to 30 feet and to either turn on or off its light. The light bug can be colored as you like.
A creature can squash this bug with a successful Dexterity check against your spell save DC, ending the spell immediately. The spell also ends if the bug is subjected to any other harmful effect.

At 5th level, if you have two insects active you can move them both using the same bonus action, though they share the 30 feet of movement. At 11th level, when summoning an insect, you can choose for another creature than you to be able to command it. At 17th level, you can move each glowing insect 30 feet using your bonus action.

spell.name: Flashpalm
entries: You open your clenched hand and a glaring light flashes out, disorienting a creature within range that can see you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d10} radiant damage, and it is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Flash Enchantment
entries: Elemental energy billows from your fingers and wrap around a weapon held by an ally of your choice. Choose acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage, the next time the ally hits with a weapon attack using that weapon they deal an additional {@dice 1d8} of the chosen type and the weapon is considered to be magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunities.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage ({@dice 2d8}). This damage increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 3d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Flicker Strike
entries: You phase out of reality for a split second, making a strike as you appear and disappear. You teleport 5 feet to an unoccupied location and make a melee weapon attack against a creature within reach, dealing your normal weapon damage on a hit. After you attack you immediately teleport back to your original location.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} weapon damage to the target. This damage increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Fling Weapon
entries: You imbue your weapon with contained force, making it float in the air close at hand, vibrating softly. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a ranged attack with a melee weapon against one creature, otherwise the spell fails.
On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects. If the weapon has the Thrown property, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
Alternatively, you can cast this cantrip on a weapon that doesn't have the thrown property, it gains a thrown range of 20/60 until the start of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} weapon damage to the target, or {@dice 2d6} if it is within long range. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@dice 2d6 / 3d6}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d6 / 4d6}).

spell.name: Forget
entries: You temporarily suppress a memory, sealing it away from your mind. You can choose either one period of time, a single person, group, or activity, or any other singular thing, such as a plan or proficiency in a single skill. Any creature other than you attempting to access this memory via magic or other means must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they succeed, this spell ends. When the spell ends, the memory returns and springs to your mind, fresh and vivid.

At 5th level, you can ignore the verbal component. At 11th level, you can target an {@condition unconscious} creatures with a range of touch using this spell, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, on a success they are not affected and regain consciousness if possible. At 17th level, the spell lasts until dispelled or until you choose for it to end.

spell.name: Fresh Paint
entries: You create a magical paint that runs from your fingertips or fills a small container. You can use this paint in any way you could use ordinary paint, though it only remains tangible for 1 hour. For each additional minute you spend coating a surface in this paint, the paint remains on that surface for twice as long as before. You can create any color of paint you choose each time you cast the spell.

At 5th level, the paint remains for up to 8 hours. At 11th level, the paint lasts until removed. At 17th level, you can make the paint {@condition invisible}, glow in the dark, or have an similar effect.

spell.name: Friends

components.m: a small amount of makeup applied to the face as this spell is cast

entries: For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one creature of your choice that isn't hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature {@condition prone} to violence might attack you.
Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DM's discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.

At 5th level, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood but may not turn hostile toward you based on its disposition. A creature {@condition prone} to violence might still attack you or seek retribution in other ways. At 11th level, you can substitute the somatic and material components of this cantrip with a verbal component that you can weave into a sentence by including the word "friend". At 17th level, this spell does not require {@status concentration} when you cast it. The creature realizes you have used magic on it 1 minute after the spell ends.

spell.name: Frost Blade
entries: You pull hoarfrost across your blade and strike at your foe. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the weapon's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it rolls {@dice 1d4} and subtracts the number rolled from the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage to the target. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Frostbite
entries: You cause numbing frost to form on one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage, and it has disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Fusion
entries: You lift two objects, that are not being worn or carried, that weighs no more than 10 pounds each and touch them together. The two objects are fused together at the point that they touch and count as one object for the spell's duration.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.
A creature can use its action make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks against your spell save DC to try and end the effect.
At 5th level, the objects can weigh 25 pounds each. At 11th level, you can have three such effects active at a time. At 17th level, the objects can weigh 50 pounds.

spell.name: Ghostwrite

components.m: a quill and some blank parchment

entries: Conjures a small, {@condition invisible} ghost that is in fact a fragment of the user's own soul. Only one ghost can be active for a caster at a time. The ghost will write down every word that the user thinks while the spell is active using the quill and parchment, and can be mentally instructed to add titles, annotations, or paragraphs. If the user focuses hard on a mental image while casting the spell, the ghost will spend the full 10 minutes drawing that on the parchment instead, drawing it as accurately as it can based on the user's memory of the image.
The ghost has 1 hp, AC 11 and cannot leave the caster's side, if it dies the soul fragment returns to the owner harmlessly.
If the caster dies while the ghost is active, it will continue to write the thoughts of the caster for the duration.

At 5th level, it takes 5 minutes for the ghost to draw an image. At 11th level, the ghost can't take damage. At 17th level, it takes 1 minute for the ghost to draw an image and the ghosts lasts until you want it to end or dispelled.

spell.name: Glimmer

m.text: a coin worth at least 1 cp

entries: You flick a coin into the air and make it sparkle with shimmering light, drawing the attention of all creatures within 15 feet of you. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature that is in combat has advantage on this saving throw. If a creature fails, it suffers disadvantage on ability checks until the start of your next turn.
At 5th level, you can ignore the somatic component of the spell and you can choose which creatures are affected. At

11th level, you can ignore the verbal component and creatures in combat does not have advantage on the saving throw. At 17th level, the radius increases to 30 feet and a creature who fails the saving throw have disadvantage on ability checks for 1 minute.

spell.name: Gloom
entries: You touch one object that is 5 feet or smaller in any single dimension. Until the spell ends, the object absorbs natural light in a 20-foot radius sphere. Within that sphere, bright light becomes dim light and dim light becomes darkness. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

At 5th level, when you cast this spell and as a bonus action, you can increase or decrease the area up to a 30-foot radius and down to a minimum of 5-foot radius if you can see it and it is within 300 feet of you. At 11th level, you can fire a mote of shadow at an object up to 120 feet away, applying the spell's effects on contact. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell. At 17th level, when you cast this spell, you can make the darkness only affect some creatures, rendering the creatures unaffected by the reduced light.

spell.name: Grasping Sprout
entries: You conjure a small vine with a reach of 5 feet. Whenever a Large or smaller creature enters its reach, you may use your reaction to have the sprout attempt to grasp at its heels, stopping its movement. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn. You can have one sprout active at a time.

At 5th level, you can conjure an additional sprout when casting the spell. At 11th level, the range of both sprouts increase to 10 feet and you can have both sprouts make a grasping attempt at a creature within range using a reaction.
At 17th level, you can target a Huge or smaller creature and the range of the sprouts increase to 15 feet.

spell.name: Green-Flame Blade
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the weapon's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and green fire leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Guidance
entries: You touch one willing creature and choose a skill check. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to one such check. It can roll the die before or after making the skill check. The spell then ends.

At 5th level, you can cast this spell on a willing creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At 11th level, while rolling for the benefit of this spell, the target may reroll any 1. At 17th level, you can choose up to two creatures to receive the benefit of this spell. The spell ends when both targets have rolled, and each target may only roll once within its duration.

spell.name: Guiding Strike
entries: Your strikes let the next attack find the opponent's openings without much thought. Make a melee weapon attack against a creature within your weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and the next attack roll against the creature before the end of your next turn can't suffer disadvantage.
The spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels.
At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} weapon damage to the target. The extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Gust
entries: You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:
One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from you.

You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. It isn't pushed with enough force to cause damage.
You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters closed, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

At 5th level, when you push a creature with this spell, you may do so up to 10 feet. When you push an object with this spell, you can affect all other applicable objects within a 5-foot cube. Additionally, the spell can be used to displace vapor, gas, or fog within a 5-foot cube. At 11th level, this spell can affect Large creatures, pushing them up to 5 feet, and objects affected by this spell can be pushed up to 20 feet.
Additionally, by aiming a gust at the ground below you, you extend the distance of your high jump or long jump by 5 feet.

At 17th level, this spell can affect all creatures and objects within a 10-foot cube simultaneously. Additionally, by aiming a gust at the ground below you, you extend the distance of your high jump or long jump by 10 feet.

spell.name: Hammer of Atonement
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against a creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it becomes infused with radiant energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly makes an attack before then, it immediately takes radiant damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and the spell ends.

This spells damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage to the target, and the damage the target takes for attacking increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@dice 2d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d8}).

spell.name: Hinder
entries: You assault a Medium or smaller creature you can see within range with an {@condition invisible} force. The creature must make a Strength saving throw, on a failure its movement speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.
At 5th level, you can target creature of Large size. At 11th level, you can target Huge size and on a success, the target's movement speed is still halved. At 17th level, you can target
Gargantuan creatures, and you can target up to two creatures if both targets are Huge or smaller.

spell.name: Infestation
entries: You cause a cloud of mites, fleas, and other parasites to appear momentarily on one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and moves 5 feet in a random direction if it can move and its speed is at least 5 feet. Roll a {@dice d4} for the direction: 1., north; 2, south; 3, east; or 4, west. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and if the direction rolled is blocked, the target doesn't move.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Instill Courage
entries: You touch a willing creature and strengthens its resolve. If the target is {@condition frightened} it can repeat its saving throw with advantage, ending the effect on a success.
At 5th level, the range of this spell increase to 15 feet. At
11th level, you can target up to three creatures. At 17th level, the targets are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition for 1 minute on a success.

spell.name: Jolt
entries: Sparks fly from your fingertips, shocking a creature within range. If the target is {@condition unconscious} and reduced to 0 hit points, they gain advantage on their next death saving throw, and any ability check made to aid them also gains advantage.
If you target a hostile creature, they must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Lance of Faith
entries: A glowing spear of light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. A target hit by this lose their {@sense darkvision} feature if they have it until the end of their next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Life Thread
entries: You create a binding thread that ties your soul to the soul of creature within range. If that creature moves more than 5 feet away from you, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, and the spell ends. It also ends if you move more than 5 feet away from the creature.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 2d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 4d6}), 11th level ({@dice 6d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 8d6}).

spell.name: Light
entries: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

At 5th level, when you cast this spell, you can limit the radius of bright and dim light shed by the object, down to a minimum of 5 feet. As a bonus action, you can change the color and brightness of the light if you can see it and it is within 300 feet of you. At 11th level, you can fire a wisp of light at an object up to 120 feet away, applying the spell's effects on contact. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell. At 17th level, when you cast this spell, you can camouflage the light shed by the object, rendering it visible only to creatures within its radius.

spell.name: Lightning Lure
entries: You create a lash of lightning energy that strikes at one creature of your choice that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward you and then take {@damage 1d8} lightning damage if it is within 5 feet of you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Lullaby

components.m: a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket

entries: This spell sends a creature into a magical slumber. Roll {@dice 3d4}, this is the amount of hit points this spell can affect. Compare this amount to the hit points of a creature you can see within range of the spell. If the total equals or exceeds the target's hit points, it falls {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the target takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake it awake.
If the total is less than the target's hit points, it has disadvantage on {@skill Perception} (Wisdom) checks until the spell ends or someone takes a hostile action against it.
After being affected by this spell, a creature can't be affected again before 24 hours have passed.
The amount of hit points this spell can affect increases by {@dice 2d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 5d4}), 11th level ({@dice 7d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 9d4}).

spell.name: Macbrecadabre
entries: Whispering to the spirits of the dead, you create one of the following effects within range:
You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as the flickering of lit candles, a puff of cold wind, a cacophony of unintelligible disembodied whispers, or a faint odor of decay.

Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Tiny beast within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature (CR 0). The target becomes a beast skeleton if you chose bones or a beast zombie if you chose a corpse. You do not maintain control of the creature and it cannot become a familiar.
You instantly make a flower wither, meat spoil, or milk curdle.
Touching a humanoid corpse, you can hear the echo of a single word it has said during its life if it has the necessary parts for speech.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

At 5th level, you can have up to five non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss all such effects as an action. Additionally, you can reanimate a Small or smaller beast. At 11th level, the range of the spell increases to 30 feet. You can any amount of flowers wither, meat spoil, or milk curdle within range simultaneously. At 17th level, you can reanimate a Medium or smaller beast. Also, you can hear the echo of a sentence it has said during its life. The duration of all of your non-instantaneous effects increases up to 1 hour.

spell.name: Mage Hand
entries: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.
The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

At 5th level, you can ignore the verbal component of this spell. When you cast this spell, you can make the hand appear fully corporeal, albeit featureless. At 11th level, the spell's range increases to 60 feet. When you cast this spell, you can make the hand appear with any features and adornments you like, as long as it retains the general structure of a hand, such as an armored gauntlet, bestial paw or a bloody dismembered limb. At 17th level, the hand can carry up to 20 pounds and can be made to appear twice as large.

spell.name: Mage Bolt
entries: Make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature that you can see within range and roll a {@dice 1d4} and add it to the roll, if you roll a 4 on it, the attack is a critical hit. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4 + 1} force damage.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4 + 1} when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d4 + 2}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4 + 3}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4 + 4}).

spell.name: Magic Arrow

m.text: a piece of ranged ammunition which the spell consumes

entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature that you can see within range. On a hit, you deal {@damage 1d12} piercing damage.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Magic Stone
entries: You touch one to three pebbles and imbue them with magic.

You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it or hurling it with a sling. If thrown, a pebble has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with a pebble, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attackers, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Whether the attack hits or misses, the spell then ends on the stone.
If you cast this spell again, the spell ends on any pebbles still affected by your previous casting.

At 5th level, you can cast this spell on one to five small, nonmagical objects that fit in your palm and weigh less than 1 pound each. For example, you can enchant a few playing cards, some coins, or a needle, but not a vial filled with a magical potion or an enchanted amulet. At 11th level, when used to attack, you can make the imbued object ricochet and hit a separate target of your choice within 10 feet of the original target. If you do so, make another ranged spell attack with disadvantage. On a hit, the additional target takes the spell's normal damage. At 17th level, you can cast this spell on one to ten objects and make them harmlessly float a few inches out from you in a circle. You can quickly draw floating objects to your hand as a part of the ranged attack. If an object is removed from the circle against your will, the spell immediately ends for that object.

spell.name: Magnesis
entries: You can manipulate an object primarily composed of metal, that isn't being worn or carried. The spell lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The object is released if they are ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.
You can use your action to manipulate the metal object, open a door, pull a lever, and you can move it up to 30 feet each time. You can't activate magic items or carry more than 20 pounds.

Additionally, you can use an action to shoot the object, making it fly in a straight line up to 30 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw.
On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. Both the object and what it strikes each take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Mending
entries: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

At 5th level, the spell repairs a single break or tear that is no larger than 3 feet in any dimension. Additionally, you can reassemble any number of broken fragments of an object which can fit inside a 1-foot cube. You can also remove scratches and rust from metal objects or restore burned cloth and leather as long as 4/5 of it remains intact. At 11th level, the spell repairs a single break or tear that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Additionally, you can reassemble any number of broken fragments of an object which can fit inside a 5-foot cube. You can also restore corroded metal objects to their original, untarnished state. The spell has a range of 15 feet. At 17th level, the spell has a casting time of 1 action.

spell.name: Message

components.m: a short piece of copper wire

entries: You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.
You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier.

Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

At 5th level, the spell has a range of 300 feet. At 11th level, you can ignore the somatic and material components of the spell. At 17th level, you can ignore the verbal component of the spell, sending the message to your target telepathically instead. A simple mental image may accompany this message, and your target can reply in the same way.

spell.name: Minor Illusion
entries: You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.
If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose.
The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object-such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest-it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.
At 5th level, when you cast the spell, you can delay its manifestation by up to 1 minute, after which the effect occurs as normal. At 11th level, the spell has a range of 60 feet. At
17th level, you can create an image of flowing liquid or a cacophony of sounds no louder than a scream.

spell.name: Mold Earth
entries: You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:
If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn't involve enough force to cause damage.
You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

At 5th level, you can have up to five non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss all such effects as an action. At 11th level, the shapes or colors you make appear on dirt or stone last for up to 12 hours. Additionally, you can excavate packed earth, and any earth you move with this spell can be deposited up to 15 feet away. At 17th level, this spell can manipulate dirt and stone that fits within a 10- foot cube. Additionally, shapes or colors you make appear on dirt or stone last for up to 24 hours. You can also cause all dirt or stone within 5 feet of you to turn into difficult terrain, including the ground on which you stand, for 24 hours.

spell.name: Mold Plants
entries: You choose a non-magical plant that you can see within range and that fits within a 10-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:
Change the color of the plant for 1 hour
Cause the plant to shape itself into a form you designate.
The plant's branches and leaves may twist into words, create images, or shape into patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

If the plant you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the plant to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

At 5th level, you can have up to five non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss all such effects as an action. At 11th level, the words, images, or shapes you make appear last for up to 12 hours. Additionally, you can transports plants without harming them, and you can move them 15 feet away. At 17th level, this spell can manipulate plants that fits within a 10-foot cube. Additionally, words, images or shapes you make appear last for up to 24 hours.
You can also cause all plants within 5 feet of you to turn into difficult terrain, including the ground on which you stand, for 24 hours.

spell.name: Nudge
entries: You create a small concussive blast and force it towards a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice. A Large or larger creature makes this save with advantage. If the direction is blocked or the creature can't move due to being {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition restrained}, the target doesn't move.
The distance pushed increases by 5 feet you reach 5th level (10), 11th level (15), and 17th level (20).

spell.name: Phasing Strike
entries: You use your weapon as a conduit to warp through space.

Make a melee weapon attack against one creature within your weapon's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and you can immediately teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target that you can see.
The spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels.
At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage to the target. The extra damage increases by {@dice 1d10} at 11th level ({@dice 2d10}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d10}).

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} poison damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Prestidigitation
entries: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:
You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

At 5th level, you can have up to five non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss all such effects as an action. Additionally, you can dry any willing creature that you can see within range. At 11th level, the range of the spell increases to 30 feet. You can light or snuff out any number of candles, torches, and small campfires within range simultaneously. At 17th level, you can clean or soil an object no larger than 5 cubic feet and can chill, warm or flavor up to 5 cubic feet of nonliving material. You can also create a nonmagical trinket or illusory image that can fit in a 1-foot cube. The duration of all of your non-instantaneous effects increases up to 8 hours.

spell.name: Primal Savagery
entries: You channel primal magic to cause your hand to become clawed, your mouth to be filled with sharp teeth, horns to grow out of your head, or a similar beast-like change. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you.
On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice). After you make the attack, your body return to normal.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 2d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 4d6}), 11th level ({@dice 6d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 8d6}).

spell.name: Prismatic Ray
entries: You fire off a scintillating beam of rainbow light against a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, roll {@dice 1d8} and {@dice 1d6}. The target takes {@damage 1d6} damage of the type indicated by the {@dice d8}.

entries.name: 7-8 Special
entries: The target is struck by two colors. Roll twice more, rerolling any 7 or 8.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Produce Flame
entries: A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Puff of Smoke
entries: You create a 5-foot-radius, 15-foot-high cylinder of dark-grey smoke centered on a point within range. The smoke spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. When created, the puff produces a dull thud which is audible out to 100 feet.

The smoke can be any color you desire, and you can cause it to shed dim light in a 5-foot radius in the same color. It lasts until the start of your next turn, or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
At 5th level, you can ignore the verbal component. At 11th level, the duration increases to 1 minute. At 17th level, you can choose to increase the radius by 5 feet.

spell.name: Purge
entries: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. That creature can immediately make a saving throw against an effect that allows it to make saving throws at the end on each of its turns.

At 5th level, the target can use your saving throws instead of its own. At 11th level, the spell gains a range of 30 feet and you can target any creature. At 17th level, you can target up to two creatures with this spell.

spell.name: Radiant Mark
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and it is marked with a visible mark until the beginning of your next turn. The next time the marked creature is hit by an attack by a creature other than you, the attack deals additional radiant damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier and the mark is consumed.
While marked, the creature can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d4} radiant damage to the target, and the radiant damage the target takes from getting hit by another creature increases to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d4} at 11th level ({@dice 2d4}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d4}).

spell.name: Ray of Frost
entries: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target.
On a hit, it takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Resistance
entries: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to one saving throw of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the saving throw. The spell then ends.

At 5th level, you can cast this spell on a willing creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At 11th level, while rolling for the benefit of this spell, the target may reroll any 1. At 17th level, you can choose up to two creatures to receive the benefit of this spell. The spell ends when both targets have rolled, and each target may only roll once within its duration.

spell.name: Ruin
entries: You speak a terrible word, blasting a creature or object within range with destructive power. The target must make a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} force damage. Objects and constructs targeted with this cantrip always take the maximum amount of damage per die.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Sacred Flame
entries: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Sacrificial Aid
entries: You touch a creature and sacrifice your own life essence to restore theirs. A creature you touch regains {@dice 1d4} hit points, and you lose an amount of hit points equal to twice as much as you restored. This damage can not be reduced in any way.

If you lose more hit points than you have left, the amount of excess hit points you otherwise would have lost is the amount your hit point maximum is decreased by until you finish a long rest. You also take one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
The amount of hit points you can restore increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Sapping Sting
entries: You sap the vitality of one creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage and fall {@condition prone}.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Seed Corruption
entries: You foster a physical or spiritual seed of corruption within a creature. A creature you can see is granted {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. When the temporary hit points are reduced to 0 the creature must make a Charisma saving throw, on a failure the creature suffers an amount of psychic damage equal to double the amount of temporary hit points granted, and an effect triggers based upon the amount of temporary hit points granted by this cantrip.

entries.name: Temporary
entries: hit points Effect
The creatures movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
You gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the amount you granted the creature.
9-11 The creature is knocked {@condition prone}.
The creature has disadvantage on its next saving throw it makes before the start of your next turn.
The temporary hit points granted increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th ({@dice 2d4}), 11th ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Seek Phrase
entries: You speak a word or phrase aloud and touch a book, scroll, or other object covered in writing. Each instance of that word or phrase present becomes highlighted in glowing script for the duration. If used on a book, it will flip to the first page containing the subject of your search.

At 5th level, you can as a bonus action jump to the next instance of the word or phrase in a book. At 11th level, you can ignore the verbal component of this spell and you can target one additional object (2). At 17th level, you can target two additional objects (4).

spell.name: Shadowlash
entries: You rear back and summon a shadowy whip, attempting to whip at a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack roll. If you hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} slashing damage and is shoved 5 feet directly away from you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Shape Water
entries: You choose an area of water that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:
You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn't have enough force to cause damage.
You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the water's color or opacity. The water must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You freeze the water, provided that there are no creatures in it. The water unfreezes in 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

At 5th level, you can have up to five non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss all such effects as an action. Additionally, you can boil the water, provided that there are no creatures in it. The water cools in 1 hour. At

11th level, you can manipulate other liquids if at least half of their content is water. Additionally, you can move water in any direction within range if it fits within a 1-foot cube. At 17th level, you can move up to five 1-foot cubes of water simultaneously. The duration of all of your non-instantaneous effects increases up to 8 hours. Additionally, you can cause the water to form into complex shapes.

spell.name: Shared Sight

components.m: a bowl or pool of liquid

entries: The caster ceases to see through their own eyes and instead sees through the eyes of the last person or creature they touched in the last 24 hours before casting the spell. The other senses are unaffected, and you experience the same vision that the target creature has ({@sense tremorsense|MM} is not considered vision). You cannot choose which direction the target looks or whether their eyes are open or closed.
Once the caster dismisses the effect, that creature's eyes cannot be looked through again for another 24 hours and the creature knows that someone or something has been watching through its eyes.

At 5th level, the duration increases to 10 minutes. At 11th level, you can choose if a creature you touch is eligible for the spell, though you can only have one saved at a time. At 17th level, you can choose for the target to watch through your eyes instead and you can stop or swap between as an action.
Lastly, the spell lasts until you end it or it is dispelled.

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Smothering Shadow
entries: You cause the shadow of a creature within range to grasp and claw at its owner. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage, and its movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.
If the target is in complete darkness, the spell has no effect.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Sonic Snap
entries: You snap your fingers, generating a thunderclap focused on a creature or object, this thunderclap can be heard up to 100 feet away. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage. This spell deals double damage against objects.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Soul Rend
entries: You slash in the air towards a creature within range. Make two ranged spell attacks against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. If both attacks hit the target, they strike simultaneously as a single instance of damage, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took. The target's hit point maximum returns to normal after 10 minutes.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Spare the Dying
entries: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At 5th level, you can ignore the somatic component of this spell. At 11th level, if the stabilized creature takes no further damage for 1 hour, it restores 1 hit point. At 17th level, when you cast this spell on a dying target, you can apply its effects to any other dying targets within a 10-foot radius of the original target. If the stabilized creatures take no further damage for 1 minute, they restore 1 hit point.

spell.name: Spectral Hand
entries: You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.
If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}). 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Stonefist
entries: You magically transform one of your hands into solid stone and strike your foe with it. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage. This spell deals double damage against objects.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Sweat Palm
entries: Sizzling acid oozes from your palm as you try and touch a creature. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if you are grappling the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} acid damage.
If you attack a target that you have {@condition grappled}, it deals an additional {@damage 1d4} acid damage.
Touching a nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, with the spell, very slowly corrodes it.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 2d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 4d4}), 11th level ({@dice 6d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 8d4}).

spell.name: Sword Burst
entries: You create a momentary circle of spectral blades that sweep around you. Each creature within range, other than you, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Thaumaturgy
entries: You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You create one of the following magical effects within range:
Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.
You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

At 5th level, you can change your voice to sound more angelic or more demonic for 1 minute. Additionally, you can amplify your voice up to four times as loud as normal for 1 minute. At 11th level, you can have up to four of this spell's 1- minute effects active at a time. Additionally, the tremors you cause are strong enough to rattle objects without damaging them. You can also instantaneously open or close any number of unlocked doors and windows within range. At 17th level, the duration of this spell's 1-minute effects is increased to 1 hour. Additionally, you can cause a loud noise, intense tremors, or unseen waves or slashes to deal 1 damage to all objects that aren't being worn or carried within range.

spell.name: Thieves' Ruse
entries: You make an object that weigh up to 5 pounds that you hold turn {@condition invisible} for up to 10 minutes. It turns visible if it leaves your grasp.

At 5th level, the item can be within 5 feet of you without turning visible. At 11th level, you only need an action to cast the spell and you can ignore the verbal component. At 17th level, the spell no longer requires {@status concentration}, the range of the spell increases to 5 feet and an object can be within 15 feet of you without turning visible.

spell.name: Thorn Whip

components.m: the stem of a plant with thorns

entries: You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage, and if the creature is
Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Thunderclap
entries: You create a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within range, other than you, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Toll the Dead
entries: You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment.
The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. If the target has lost half or more of its hit points, it instead takes {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d8 / 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8 / 3d12}), and 17th level

spell.name: True Strike
entries: You enter the void, letting nothing affect your ability to strike true. The next attack you make before the end of your next turn can't have disadvantage.
At 5th level, you can cast this spell as a bonus action. At
11th level, your next two attacks before the end of your next turn can't have disadvantage. At 17th level, the next attack you make before the end of your next turn have advantage.

spell.name: Umbraturgy
