The spell also masks the scent of any decaying flesh that might emanate from the target creature. You can make the target seem 1 foot shorter or taller and it can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change its body type, so you must cause it to adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs.
Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to a zombie, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel the zombie's rotting scalp beneath. If you use this spell to add flesh to a skeleton, someone who shakes the skeleton's hand might notice their own hand sink into the illusory flesh as they grasp its cold, boney fingers.

To discern that the target creature is disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect the target creature's appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can disguise one additional undead creature (creating a unique appearance for each) for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Oath-Sealing Covenant
entries: When two willing creatures make a promise to one another you seal it with magic and a prayer. If either creature breaks the promise they made the other immediately knows the promise has been broken and this spell ends. If this spell ends as the result of another spell, both creatures become aware of that fact.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. Each creature must touch at least another targeted creature.

spell.name: Ocean Pulse
entries: You attempt to hit a creature within range with a blast of salty water, forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, the target takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. Creatures that is Large or larger is immune to the {@condition prone} effect of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Overgrowth
entries: You create an area of thick overgrowth centered in a 10-foot square. The area is heavily obscured and difficult terrain. It lasts for the duration or until it is destroyed.
If the overgrowth is lit on fire, it burns away immediately.
Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage, or half damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the square increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Phase Rush
entries: You create a rift in spacetime, teleporting up to 15 feet. Each creature between the starting point and end point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage, or half on a successful save. If you would arrive in a place already occupied by a object or a creature, you take {@damage 2d8} force damage and the spell fails to teleport you.
In addition, objects in the line, such as wood or stone, automatically takes full damage from the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Protection from Evil and Good

m.text: holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.
The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target.

The target also can't be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by them. If the target is already {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Pull/Push
entries: You splay your fingers and cause a creature or an object you can see within range to either fly towards or away from your empty hand. Choose either a creature or an object that isn't worn. If the target or the creature holding the object is unwilling, it can make a Strength saving throw. A Larger or larger creature makes this save with advantage. On a success, the spell has no effect.

entries.name: Pull
entries: You create a focused vacuum in your empty hand, pulling at the creature or object. On a failure, a creature is pulled into your open palm and become {@condition grappled} by you. An object is pulled into and grasped by your empty hand.

entries.name: Push
entries: You create a focused blast of air in your empty hand, pushing away the creature or object. On a failure, a creature is pushed 30 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}. If it hits a creature, wall, or another stationary object, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet blocked. If it got pushed into a creature, that creature takes the damage as well. An object is pushed 30 feet away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range and distance pushed both increase by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Purify Food and Drink
entries: All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of poison and disease.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Quickened Strike
entries: Make a weapon attack against a creature within range.

spell.name: Radiant Shield

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature take damage

entries: You call out a monosyllabic exclamation which causes a shimmering field of light to appear around the creature. The target gains {@dice 3d6} temporary hit points until the start of its next turn. The damage from the triggering attack is deducted from the target's temporary hit point pool.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of temporary hit points granted is increased by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rain of Arrows
entries: You chant a minor incantation, brushing the arrows in your quiver with a feather. Upon finishing the casting, spectral duplicates of your arrows appear at a point in the sky you can see with in range, forming a 10-foot radius cylinder up to 40 feet tall. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rapport Spores
entries: You conjure a 30-foot radius of spores extending from your position. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. For the duration, affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 60 feet of each other.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range which creatures can communicate with one another increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness
entries: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Reaper's Scythe

components.m: a piece of a scythe blade

entries: You create a scythe out of necrotic energy in your free hands.
The scythe is a large weapon, requires both hands to wield, and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the scythe, it disappears, but you can conjure it again as a bonus action.
You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the scythe. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d4} necrotic damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Refit

m.text: crystal dust worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You make an item you touch the appropriate size for a creature of one size larger or smaller than its original form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can transform it up to two sizes larger or smaller. When changing it two sizes, the crystal dust needs to be worth 100 gp.

spell.name: Rimesworn Blade
entries: When you cast this spell, you infuse your weapon with chilling cold and coat the exterior with brittle ice. You then take the {@action Attack} action. The first time you hit with this weapon, the target takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage, shattering the ice on your weapon. The target and creatures within 10 feet of the target other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw.
If they fail, they take {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the piercing damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Safety Net

time.condition: which you take when you or an allied creature is forced to move

entries: When the target is forced to move in any direction and within 10 feet of solid ground, you can use your reaction to call forth vines from the ground. They wrap around the creature's body and keep it in place and remain to do so until the start of the target's next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Salamander's Sight
entries: For the duration, you can see heat as a form of light out to 60 feet. You can immediately tell if a creature has a very low body temperature, such as most undead or constructs, or detect heat sources such as smothered coals. You cannot see heat through solid obstacles.

You can see a creature or object in darkness as though it were illuminated by dim light, and in dim light as though it were brightly lit, provided its temperature is noticeably higher or lower than its surroundings. You cannot discern color in darkness, only relative temperature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range of the sight increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sanctuary
entries: You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.
If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Searing Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon flares with white-hot intensity, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target and causes the target to ignite in flames. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage. On a successful save, the spell ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shed Skin
entries: You channel the peculiarity of snakes and gain the ability to shed your skin. Casting this spell while you are being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} ends the condition and allows you to move up to 5 feet as part of casting the spell without provoking opportunity attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can move an additional 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

entries: An {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus increases by one for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Shield of Faith

components.m: a small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

entries: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus increases by one for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Shrill Whistle
entries: You place your hand to your lips, blowing through them in a terrible note. All creatures of your choosing within range take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they are {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn. This whistle is audible up to 300 feet away, even in adverse conditions.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Silent Image
entries: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

You can use your action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the dimensions of the cube increases by 5 feet for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Skewering Spears
entries: You create a small rumble beneath a creature's feet or in a wall beside a creature, causing six spears made of metal to quickly protrude from the ground to skewer the target.

Choose a 5-foot square, a Large or smaller creature within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage and is {@condition restrained}. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}.

The creature can use its action to make a Strength saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the creature fails the saving throw, the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d10} piercing damage and remains {@condition restrained}. A Large or larger creature makes its saving throw with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can choose to target an adjacent 5-foot square for each slot level above 1st. If the majority of a creature is within the area, it does not make its save with advantage.

spell.name: Sleep

components.m: a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket

entries: This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll {@dice 6d8}; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring {@condition unconscious} creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.
Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional {@dice 3d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Slicing Leaves
entries: You touch up to 6 leaves and imbue them with magic, hardening them and making their edges razor sharp. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the leaves by throwing it with a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with a leaf, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attacker's, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes slashing damage equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on the leaf.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of leaves you can effect with this spell increases by 2 and their damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Snare

m.text: 25 feet of rope, which the spell consumes

entries: As you cast this spell, you use the rope to create a circle with a 5-foot radius on the ground or the floor. When you finish casting, the rope disappears and the circle becomes a magic trap.
This trap is nearly {@condition invisible}, requiring a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC to be discerned.

The trap triggers when a Small, Medium, or Large creature moves onto the ground or the floor in the spell's radius. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be magically hoisted into the air, leaving it hanging upside down 3 feet above the ground or the floor. The creature is {@condition restrained} there until the spell ends.

A {@condition restrained} creature can make a Dexterity saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Alternatively, the creature or someone else who can reach it can use an action to make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, the {@condition restrained} effect ends.
After the trap is triggered, the spell ends when no creature is {@condition restrained} by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can create an additional trap within 30 feet of the first one for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Snowshoes
entries: One creature of your choice within range gains the ability to walk lightly over ice and snow without having its speed reduced. The creature can move across difficult terrain created by ice or snow without spending extra movement and doesn't need to make Dexterity checks to avoid slipping on or cracking ice. The creature leaves almost no trace in such terrain, so the base DC to track it across ice or snow is 25.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Speak with Animals
entries: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

spell.name: Stumble
entries: You interfere with a creature's leg coordination. For the duration, whenever the target moves more than 5 feet on their turn, you can use your reaction to force them succeed a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and lose the rest of their movement.
Creatures using a flying or swimming speed for their movement are immune to this spell's effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Summon Orchestra

m.text: a music sheet covered in magic worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You summon a ghostly orchestra of up to five ethereal instruments in a empty space. You choose which instruments and they follow your commands, such as following a creature or playing a simple beat. As a bonus action, you can mentally command it if it is within 90 feet of you. It can move up to 30 feet on your turn.
If you issue no commands, the orchestra will idly play a snippet of music from your mind. Once given an order, the 79 instrument continues to follow it until the task is complete.

Finally, as an action, you can concentrate on this spell until you choose not to. While you do so, as long as you are within 30 feet of the instrument, you can cast spells that deal thunder damage as if you were standing in its space. The spell is cast as if it was cast at one level higher.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter

components.m: tiny tarts and a feather that is waved in the air

entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter if this spell affects it. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} and unable to stand up for the duration. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isn't affected.
At the end of each of its turns, and each time it takes damage, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw.
The target has advantage on the saving throw if it's triggered by damage. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Temporal Window
entries: You create a small rift, 1 feet in diameter, which bridges the distance between it and any point within range that you can see or specify by distance or direction (such as "30 feet straight up"). While next to the rift, you are considered to be next to the destination as well. You can for example; see through it, attack through it, use an object as you were next to the exit, but you cannot move through it. It lasts until the end your turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level, the range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tenser's Floating Disk
entries: This spell creates a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3 feet above the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The disk remains for the duration, and can hold up to 500 pounds. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything on the disk falls to the ground.

The disk is immobile while you are within 20 feet of it. If you move more than 20 feet away from it, the disk follows you so that it remains within 20 feet of you. It can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like. but it can't cross an elevation change of 10 feet or more. For example, the disk can't move across a 10-foot-deep pit, nor could it leave such a pit if it was created at the bottom.
If you move more than 100 feet from the disk (typically because it can't move around an obstacle to follow you), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level, the weight it can hold increases by 500 pounds for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thieves' Handshake

m.text: your spit and the spit of the target, which the spell consumes

entries: As you cast the spell you shake the hand of a willing creature.

For the duration, both you and the target have disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks made against the other, as well as have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made towards the other.
If the spell ends early, it ends for both you and the target, and both you and the target are aware that the spell has ended.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. Each creature needs to shake the hand of every other creature targeted.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderwave
entries: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you.
On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell's effect, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tilt

components.m: a small metal ball and spring

entries: You twist a creature's sense of balance and trick it into seeing the world shift beneath its feet. Choose a creature on a surface within range. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, or fall {@condition prone} and slide 20 feet in a straight line in a direction of your choice.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the distance sled increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Traitor's Malice
entries: You attack a creature's mind, wracking them with terrible hallucinations and compulsions. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns for one minute. Each time it fails, the target must use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet of your choice that you can see. Once it lands a successful attack caused by this effect, the effect ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the effect on the cursed target lasts for one additional successful hit for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Traveling Armory

m.text: a quartz ring, worth at least 10 gp

entries: Choose up to two objects of the following; an armor, shield, or weapon that is neither worn nor carried. As you finish casting the spell, the objects are teleported inside the ring used in the casting of this spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to speak a command word of your choosing to summon it from inside the ring and equip or teleport them back into the ring. You can choose a different command word for each item. You can only teleport an object back inside the ring if you are carrying it.
If the ring is removed from your finger or if you cast this spell again, the spell ends and the objects appear in an empty space within 5 feet of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional object for each slot level above 1st. You need a different command word for each item, but can speak them all during the same bonus action.

spell.name: Unburden
entries: A creature you touch no longer suffers the penalties to movement speed or to their Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check while wearing armor, and is no long encumbered from carry weight unless they are carrying more than twice the weight that would encumber them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Undead Puppet

components.m: fine string and a small piece of wood

entries: This spell creates an undead puppet for you to control.

Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with foul energies that you can manipulate, raising it as an undead creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command the creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn. Issuing a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor, has no effect. If you issue no commands, the creature does nothing.
Once the spell ends, the creature goes back to being an inanimate corpse or pile of bones.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you animate an additional undead creature for each slot level above 1st. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones. As a bonus action on your turn, you can issue a single command to any number of undead you have animated via this spell.

spell.name: Unseen Servant

components.m: a piece of string and a bit of wood

entries: This spell creates an {@condition invisible}, mindless, shapeless Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.
If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you summon an additional servant for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Unstable Lightning
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range.

On a hit, you deal {@damage 2d8} lightning damage, and if there is another creature within 10 feet, make another attack roll, on a hit the spell jumps to yet another target. This spell cannot hit the same target twice.
If there are multiple targets for the jump, the DM randomly determines the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wall of Paper
entries: A wall of paper unwraps itself into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface.

You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 5 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made of five 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is literally paper thin. It lasts for the duration and can't be seen through.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice). If move into, the wall moves with the creature, collapsing on top of it. If the wall is attacked or would take damage, it tears, cuts, or burns easily. If it would be damaged by fire, it spreads, {@condition burning|HA:GS} one 5-by-5 foot area per adjacent {@condition burning|HA:GS} area at the start of each of your turns. A burned section harmlessly drifts off as ash.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can create an additional panel for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Witch Bolt

components.m: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entries: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained are of lightning between you and the target. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal {@damage 1d12} lightning damage to the target automatically. The spell also ends if the target is ever more than 90 feet from you or if it has total cover from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both instances of damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} psychic damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a Wisdom check against your spell save DC to steel its resolve and end this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Zephyr Strike
entries: You move like the wind. Until the spell ends, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn. That attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} weapon damage on a hit. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.

spell.name: Accursed Wish
entries: You speak aloud, demanding a boon from one of the darkest planes. You instantly replicate the effects of any spell of 1st level with a casting time of 1 action or bonus action that deals damage, or any cantrip from any spell list. Each time you cast this spell, roll a {@dice d20}. If the result is a 1, you are struck by an unholy force, reducing you to 0 hit points immediately after the spell is cast. If you are struck down a second time due to this spell before you finish a long rest, you are reduced to 0 hit points and fail two death saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, you can replicate a spell of 2nd level or lower, and the threshold for being struck down increases to a result of 2 or lower. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, you can replicate a spell of 3nd level or lower, and the threshold for being struck down increases to a result of 3 or lower. This pattern continues until the spell is cast using a slot of 7th or higher level, where no additional effect is gained and the threshold is not increased.

spell.name: Aganazzar's Scorcher
entries: A line of roaring flame 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aid

components.m: a tiny strip of while cloth

entries: Your spell bolsters your allies with toughness and resolve.
Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, a target's hit points increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Alter Self
entries: You assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

entries.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries: You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change.
You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape slays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance.
At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

entries.name: Height Acclimation
entries: You acclimate your body to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to cold climates.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd. Additionally, when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the natural weapons bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

spell.name: Angelskin

components.m: a bit of leather and a pinch of silvery glitter

entries: You imbue yourself with celestial radiance, causing your skin and hair to glimmer with a silvery sheen. For the duration, you have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage, and when a fiend or undead attack you, you can use your reaction to cause the attack to be made with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Animal Messenger
entries: By means of this spell, you use an animal to deliver a message. Choose a Tiny beast you can see within range, such as a squirrel, a blue jay, or a bat.

You specify a location, which you must have visited, and a recipient who matches a general description, such as "a man or woman dressed in the uniform of the town guard" or "a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat." You also speak a message of up to twenty-five words. The target beast travels for the duration of the spell toward the specified location, covering about 50 miles per 24 hours for a flying messenger, or 25 miles for other animals.

When the messenger arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, replicating the sound of your voice. The messenger speaks only to a creature matching the description you gave. If the messenger doesn't reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the beast makes its way back to where you cast this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3nd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 48 hours for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Arc Lightning
entries: Choose two creatures you can see in range that are within 30 feet of each other. A bolt of lightning leaps between the two targets. Both the targets and all creatures in a line between them must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} lightning damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the damage by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Arcane Lock

m.text: gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes locked for the duration. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can open the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute. Otherwise, it is impassable until it is broken or the spell is dispelled or suppressed. Casting knock on the object suppresses arcane lock for 10 minutes.
While affected by this spell, the object is more difficult to break or force open; the DC to break it or pick any locks on it increases by 10.

spell.name: Arm of the Wild
entries: You transform one of your arms into an extendable vine whose end sticks to any surface that it touches. The arm cannot be used to wield any objects or weapons. On every turn within the duration, including the turn that you cast the spell, you can make either of the following actions:

entries.name: Grab Creature
entries: As a bonus action, you extend your vine arm forward, attempting to pull one creature you choose within 20 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled 10 feet directly towards you.

entries.name: Grab Surface
entries: As a bonus action, you extend your vine arm forward, pulling yourself to a hard surface such as a wall or ceiling within 20 feet of you. If this movement would cause you to be suspended off the ground, you remain so until you take an action or the {@status concentration} ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the reach 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Augury

m.text: specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp

entries: By casting gem-inlaid sticks, rolling dragon bones, laying out ornate cards, or employing some other divining tool, you receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes, The DM chooses from the following possible omens:
Weal, for good results
Woe, for bad results
Weal and woe, for both good and bad results
Nothing, for results that aren't especially good or bad
The spell doesn't take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion.
If you cast the spell two or more times before completing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get a random reading.
The DM makes this roll in secret.

spell.name: Aura of Shade
entries: You create a 15-foot radius sphere of shadow magic centered on a point within range. The area appears to be wreathed in swirling shadows and darkness, and is easily identifiable when it is in an area of bright or dim light. The sphere spreads around corners, and each creature that ends their turn within the area becomes {@condition invisible}. This invisibility ends for a creature if they attack, cast a spell, or leave the area.
Anything they are wearing or carrying is also {@condition invisible} as long as they are.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Barkskin
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target's AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor it is wearing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. Each creature must touch at least another targeted creature.

spell.name: Beast Sense
entries: You touch a willing beast. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to see through the beast's eyes and hear what it hears, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. While perceiving through the beast's senses, you gain the benefits of any special senses possessed by that creature, though you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own surroundings.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Bestial Charge
entries: You conjure horns and rush at a target within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} bludgeoning damage. If you move at least 20 feet straight at the target before casting this spell, you can choose one of the following effects to inflict upon it on a hit:
The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you.
The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The target takes an additional {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Black Pillar
entries: You gesture to the ground and speak an incantation, calling a pillar of stone to rise from the earth at a location within range. The pillar is 15 feet tall, 5 feet on each side, covered in cruel spikes, and has a flat top that can be safely stood upon.

If a creature is caught between the pillar and another surface, such as a ceiling, they must make a Dexterity saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} in the nearest open space. If a creature is shoved or pushed against the sides of the pillar, they take {@damage 1d12} piercing damage. The pillar can be climbed safely by making an Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC equal to your spell save DC. The pillar has 50 hit points, 10 AC, immunity to poison and psychic damage, as well as resistance to piercing and slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the piercing damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blindness/Deafness
entries: You inflict a wound upon yourself to create a protective seal on another creature within range. As you cast the spell, you expend a number of hit points and the target gains {@dice 1d10} + the number of hit points spent as temporary hit points for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target gains {@dice 1d10} additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blur
entries: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with {@sense blindsight}, or can see through illusions, as with {@sense truesight}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 minute for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Branding Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike, The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it's {@condition invisible}, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become {@condition invisible} until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Calm Emotions
entries: You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.

You can suppress any effect causing a target to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Channeling Bond

m.text: a pair of copper rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration

entries: You place your hand upon a willing creature and create a magical bond between you and your target. For the duration, any spell with a range of touch that you cast upon the target can be cast from up to 60 feet away.
The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if you cast the spell again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range with which you can cast spells targeting the creature increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Charm of Protection

m.text: a golden ring, bracelet, or necklace worth at least 50 gp in total

entries: You touch the piece of jewelry that serves as the material component for this spell, bestowing magical energy into it.

This magic activates when certain conditions are met. By default, it activates when an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead moves within 30 feet of the jewelry. This trigger can be refined to only activate for a subset of those creature types, and you can choose to exclude specific creatures of your choice from triggering the activation.

When the magic activates, the jewelry begins to glow, emitting bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that. The color of this light depends on the creature type of the creature that activated this magic: purple for aberrations, white for celestials, blue for elementals, yellow for fey, red for fiends, and green for undead. Also, the jewelry creates a magical ward. Roll {@dice 4d4}. The ward has hit points equal to the number rolled. Whenever the jewelry's wearer would take damage from an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the wearer takes any remaining damage.
The magic remains activated for 10 minutes, or until the ward is reduced to 0 hit points. Then the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the ward's hit points increase by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Clinging Shadows
entries: You choose an area of dim light or darkness that you can see within range and that fits within a 20-foot cube. Each creature within the area must succeed on Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by shadows until the spell ends. A creature {@condition restrained} by the shadows can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

Until the spell ends, you can use an action on each of your turns to cause a tendril of shadow to reach out and grab a creature within 15 feet of the area. The creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pulled into the area and becomes {@condition restrained}.
If the area becomes bathed in bright light, the spell has no effect until the bright light fades.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the cube increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cloud of Daggers
entries: You fill the air with spinning daggers in a cube 5 feet on each side, centered on a point you choose within range. A creature takes {@damage 4d4} slashing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cold Snap
entries: You quickly chill the air in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. Creatures in the affected area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the cold damage by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Contain Blast

time.condition: which you take when you can see an explosion begin within range

entries: As the explosion starts, you create a barrier around it and force it onto itself. While {@status concentration||concentrating} on the spell, the explosion does not happen until the spell ends and at the start of each of your turns while {@status concentration||concentrating} on it, you reduce the explosion's damage by two dice. For example, a fireball would be reduced from {@dice 7d6} to {@damage 5d6} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you reduce the damage by one additional die for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cordon of Arrows

components.m: four or more arrows or bolts

entries: You plant four pieces of nonmagical ammunition, in the ground within range and lay magic upon them to protect an area. Until the spell ends, whenever a creature other than you comes within 30 feet of the ammunition for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, one piece of ammunition flies up to strike it. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. The piece of ammunition is then destroyed. The spell ends when no ammunition remains.
When you cast this spell, you can designate any creatures you choose, and the spell ignores them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of ammunition that can be affected increases by two for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Corrode Metal
entries: Choose a nonmagical metal object such as a stove, weapon, suit of armor, or shield that you can see within range. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action until the spell ends you cause the object to rust and corrode. The spell has different effects depending on your target.

entries.name: Armor
entries: The armor receives a -1 penalty to the AC it offers.
A nonmagical armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

entries.name: Shield
entries: The shield receives a -1 penalty to the AC it offers.
A nonmagical shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

entries.name: Weapon
entries: The weapon takes a -1 penalty to its attack and damage rolls. A nonmagical weapon that drops to -3 penalty is destroyed.

entries.name: Other Object
entries: An object takes 3 pounds of acid damage.
An object that is reduced to 0 pounds is destroyed.
While an object is under the effect of the spell it is vulnerable to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
The effect the spell has on an item is not removed after the spell ends but can be removed with mending or similar spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional object for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Create Quicksilver

m.text: 50 sp, which the spell consumes

entries: You congeal silver coins into an oozing mass of liquid metal, which takes on the form of a gray ooze in an unoccupied space you can see within range.

The ooze is friendly to you and your companions. The ooze acts directly after your turn. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to it, it defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. If the ooze is reduced to 0 hit points, it reverts back to the a pile of silver coins.
If your {@status concentration} is broken, the ooze doesn't disappear.

Instead, you lose control of the ooze, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled ooze can't be dismissed by you, and it reverts to a pile of silver coins 1 hour after its creation.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the ooze gains an additional 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points and gains a +1 bonus to its AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Creeping Frost
entries: The ground beneath a creature that you can see within range suddenly turns icy cold. At the end of the creature's next turn, the ice rushes to freeze them and the target takes {@damage 5d6} cold damage. For every 5 feet the target has moved away from the location where it was targeted by this spell, the damage is reduced by {@dice 1d6}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase damage by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Crescent Edge
entries: You create a crescent-shaped sword of solidified moonlight in your hand. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a hit and has the finesse and light properties. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.

When you use the sword to attack a shapechanger, you have advantage on the attack roll. If you hit a shapechanger with your moon blade, it must succeed on a Charisma saving or instantly revert to its original form. An affected shapechanger can't assume a different form until it the end of their next turn.
When you use the sword to attack an undead creature, you gain a bonus to your damage rolls equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum: 1).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Crown of Madness
entries: One humanoid of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, a twisted crown of jagged iron appears on its head, and a madness glows in its eyes.

The {@condition charmed} target is hostile towards all other creatures, and considers them hostile in turn. On its turn, it will use its movement to move as close as it can towards the nearest creature it can see and use its action to make a melee attack against them if they are within range. If it can't reach a creature, it takes the {@action Dash} action to move closer. If two or more creatures are equally close, the creature is chosen randomly. The target does not take any other actions on its turn, and if the target cannot see any other creature it does not move or take action until it does.
The target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dark Secret
entries: You whisper a phrase into the mind of the target, unknown to you but clear and terrifying to them. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. Until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws involving your target or actions it has taken.

During this time, the target has disadvantage on all ability checks and attack rolls involving you or actions you have taken. Targets that are immune to being {@condition frightened} are immune to this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose one additional target for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Darkness

components.m: bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

entries: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with {@sense darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of the same level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Darkvision

components.m: either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate

entries: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see in the dark. For the duration, that creature has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the range of the {@sense darkvision} by 30 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Detect Thoughts
entries: For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature - what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends.

Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.
Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.
Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Devilish Hunt
entries: You conjure three barbed harpoons of intricately twisted silver, which float in the air above your head for the spell's duration. When you cast the spell, and as an action while the spell lasts, you can make a ranged spell attack to hurl a harpoon at a target you can see within 90 feet of you. If you miss, the harpoon returns to the air above you.

If you hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage and the harpoon lodges in their flesh. For each harpoon lodged inside a creature, its speed is reduced by 5 feet and you can use a bonus action to pull the creature 10 feet towards you. The target can use an action to pull any number of harpoons out, taking {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage for each harpoon removed and causing the harpoon to fade. Once all three harpoons have faded, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Disabling Bolt
entries: As part of casting this spell you take the {@action Attack} action with a ranged or thrown weapon, as you channel energy into the weapon's ammunition, or the weapon itself if it's a thrown weapon. The first attack you make deals an additional {@damage 2d6} thunder damage.

Whether you hit or miss the first attack, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Constitution saving throw as the concussive energy erupts. On a failure, a creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.
This thunderous effect is audible to 300 feet.
If a creature is surprised, it makes its save with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Discordant Thrum
entries: You emit an uncomfortable cacophony. Each living creature in a 15-foot cone that can see or hear you makes an Intelligence saving throw. If they fail, they cannot communicate and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 6 or lower are immune.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the area of the spell increases by 5 feet for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Dissociative Edge
entries: When you cast this spell, you make a melee weapon attack as your weapon hums with violent energy. Whether the attack hits or misses, a scything blade of force launches forth from your weapon. Each creature within a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide must make a Dexterity saving throw. If you wield your weapon two-handed the line is instead 20 feet long. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} slashing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dome of Night
entries: You create a 15-foot radius dome of magical darkness that lasts for the duration. A creature with {@sense darkvision} cannot see through the walls of the dome, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. The dome is filled with dim light, and the inside of the dome shows an accurate representation of the night sky, including the current location of the stars and moon.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of the same level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

spell.name: Doublespeak
entries: You and another willing creatures within 5 feet of you have your words cloaked in secrecy, disguising your conversation.

As long as the other creature is within range, whatever you speak of amongst one another sounds to the casual observer like mundane conversation about the weather, the taste of the food, local politics, or other banal topics. The illusion also modifies your facial expressions and mouth movements to match the illusory words being spoken.
To discern the true nature of the conversation, a creature can use its action to eavesdrop and must succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check against your spell save DC.
You and the other targets of the spell know the general topics your illusory voices discussed, but not any of the precise phrases or details they may have used.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: You touch one willing creature and imbue it with the power to spew magical energy from its mouth, provided it has one.

Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Until the spell ends, the creature can use an action to exhale energy of the chosen type in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dust Devil
entries: Choose an unoccupied 5-foot cube of air that you can see within range. An elemental force that resembles a dust devil appears in the cube and lasts for the spell's duration.

Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the dust devil must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the dust devil. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

As a bonus action, you can move the dust devil up to 30 feet in any direction. If the dust devil moves over sand, dust, loose dirt, or light gravel, it sucks up the material and forms a 10-foot-radius cloud of debris around itself that lasts until the start of your next turn. The cloud heavily obscures its area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Earthbind
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. Yellow strips of magical energy loop around the creature. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or its flying speed (if any) is reduced to 0 feet for the spell's duration. An airborne creature affected by this spell safely descends at 60 feet per round until it reaches the ground or the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ehlonna's Blessing

m.text: a small diamond worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You return a dead beast you touch to life, provided that it has been dead for no longer than 8 hours, and did not die from old age. If the beast's soul is both willing and at liberty to rejoin the body, the beast returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell also neutralizes any poison and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the beast at the time its death. This spell doesn't remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the beast returns to life.

This spell closes all wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival - its head, for instance - the spell automatically fails.

spell.name: Enhance Ability

components.m: fur or a feather from a beast

entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

entries.name: Bear's Endurance
entries: The target has advantage on Constitution checks. It also gains {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points, which are lost when the spell ends.

entries.name: Bull's Strength
entries: The target has advantage on Strength checks, and his or her carrying capacity doubles.

entries.name: Cat's Grace
entries: The target has advantage on Dexterity checks. It also doesn't take damage from falling 20 feet or less if it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Eagle's Splendor
entries: The target has advantage on Charisma checks.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: The target has advantage on Intelligence checks.

entries.name: Owl's Wisdom
entries: The target has advantage on Wisdom checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Enlarge/Reduce
entries: You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw.
On a success, the spell has no effect.
If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

entries.name: Enlarge
entries: The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category-from Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage.

entries.name: Reduce
entries: The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category-from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
