entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the bludgeoning damage by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Web
entries: You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range, The webs fill a 20-foot cube from that point for the duration, The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure their area.

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the conjured web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

Each creature that starts its turn in the webs or that enters them during its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained} as long as it remains in the webs or until it breaks free.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the webs can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.
The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing {@damage 2d4} fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the dimension of the cube by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wing Buffet
entries: You summon large wings behind you that beat with a furious cadence. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage. On a success, a creature takes half damage but is not knocked {@condition prone}. Until the end of your turn you gain a fly speed of 15 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Zone of Truth
entries: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

spell.name: Almighty Assault
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee weapon attack against one creature or location within your weapon's range. Depending on the damage type the weapon deals, the spell has a different area of effect:

entries.name: Bludgeoning
entries: Explosive energy emanates from the attack, and each creature other than you within 10 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw.

entries.name: Piercing
entries: A pure beam of energy streams from the attack, and each creature in a 60-foot line, 5 foot wide line must make a Dexterity saving throw.

entries.name: Slashing
entries: A crescent of energy races from the attack, and each creature in a 20-foot cone in the direction of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw.
Creatures that fail their saving throw take {@damage 2d10} radiant damage, are pushed 10 feet back, and fall {@condition prone}. If a creature was hit by your attack it makes its with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Animate Blood
entries: You animate droplets of your own blood to act under your command. For every three hit points expended in the casting of this spell, you create a droplet of animated blood. As you cast this spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command the droplets to move as long as they are within 120 feet of you. The droplets have a speed of 30 feet, and a climbing speed of 15 feet.

As an action on your turn, you can choose to see and hear from the location of one of the blood droplets until the end of your turn, becoming {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own surroundings. Additionally, you may instead use your action to cause one of the droplets to explode in a burst of necromantic energy, destroying the droplet and damaging surrounding creatures. Each creature within 5 feet of the droplet must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 6d4} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Animate Dead

components.m: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

entries: This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range.
Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature. The target becomes a {@creature skeleton} if you chose bones or a {@creature zombie} if you chose a corpse.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends.
This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional undead creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

spell.name: Arcane Advance
entries: You flash forward with a blur of speed, advancing upon your foe with a series of lunges. As part of casting this spell and as an action while {@status concentration||concentrating} on the spell, you can teleport to an unoccupied location you can see within 15 feet of you and make a melee weapon attack against a creature within reach.
On a hit, you deal an additional {@damage 1d10} weapon damage.
You can teleport three times before the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can teleport an additional time for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aura of Repulsion

m.text: a pair of small iron bars attached to two small canine statuettes, one black and one white, the whole array worth 50 gold

entries: For the duration, no creature within 15 feet of you can willingly come closer to you unless you allow it or it succeeds on a Strength saving throw. If a creature fails it cannot move closer to you that turn. If you move closer to a creature within range, it must be succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet back. If it succeeds on its saving throw it cannot be pushed back again this turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for ever two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Aura of Vitality
entries: Healing energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. You can use a bonus action to cause one creature in the aura (including you) to regain {@dice 2d6} hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Beacon of False Life
entries: Necromantic energy emanates from you in a 30-foot radius area. Until the spell ends, the area moves with you, centered on you. While within the area, you and every creature that you have under your control (such as through an animate dead spell) gains {@dice 2d4} temporary hit points at the start of each of their turns. These temporary hit points last until they leave the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Beacon of Hope
entries: This spell bestows hope and vitality. Choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for ever two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Beacon of the Deluded
entries: You create a swirling ball of purple madness. Each creature within 30 feet of the ball must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failure, it must use all of its movement speed to move as close as possible to the ball as they can without having to use violence as they hear it calling out to them. Once it reaches the orb, its movement is reduced to 0 as it spends all its movement making bizarre and unexplainable gestures and movements until the spell ends.
The first time an unaffected creature moves within 30 feet of the ball, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or suffer the same effect.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its madness. On a successful save a creature is immune to this casting of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bestial Brand
entries: You touch a beast or monstrosity at least one size larger than you and bind it to your will as a mount. Roll {@dice 10d10}, if the creature's remaining hit points are less than this roll, you can clamber onto the creature as part of the action used to cast the spell. As long as you keep one hand on the mount and its hit points are below your roll, it is {@condition charmed} by you and you can control the creature as your mount which accepts you as a rider.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do.
During this time, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to use its reaction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you add an additional {@dice 2d8} to the roll for each slot level above the 3rd.

spell.name: Bestow Curse
entries: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:
Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the target.

A remove curse spell ends this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a curse's effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is {@status concentration}, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require {@status concentration}.

spell.name: Blasphemy
entries: You project a sphere of magic which turns the positive energy of healing magic into negative energy. Each time a creature within a 90-foot radius of you would recover hit points from a spell, it must make a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, it takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and does not recover hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blessed Weapon
entries: A nonmagical weapon you touch becomes a magic weapon.
For the duration, the weapon has a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals an extra {@dice 1d4} radiant when it hits. It deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage against fiends and undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the bonus to attack rolls increases to +2 and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d4}. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3 and the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d4}.

spell.name: Blinding Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon flares with bright light, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blink
entries: Roll a {@dice d20} at the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell. On a roll of 11 or higher, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane (the spell fails and the casting is wasted if you were already on that plane). At the start of your next turn, and when the spell ends if you are on the Ethereal Plane, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from.
If no unoccupied space is available within that range, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near). You can dismiss this spell as an action.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away. You can only affect and be affected by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Creatures that aren't there can't perceive you or interact with you, unless they have the ability to do so.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4rd level or higher, you can reduce the number you need to roll by 2 for each slot level above 3rd. For example, casting it at 5th level, you only need to roll a 7 or higher.

spell.name: Bloodsight
entries: You draw out a portion of your blood, causing your eyes to take on a crimson hue. For the duration, you can see the life force of nearby creatures. The range of this vision is a number of feet equal to 5 times the number of hit points spent on this spell. When a creature is at full health, they appear perfectly normal, but as they become more wounded a red aura begins to surround them. You can notice when a creature's current hit points are below 1/2 or 1/4 of their hit point maximum. If a creature is below 1/2 of their hit point maximum, you can see them even through walls and invisibility.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 1 hour. If you use a slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the duration is 24 hours. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require {@status concentration}.

spell.name: Boil
entries: You cause the area of a 40-foot cube within range to instantly increase in temperature. This temperature increase lasts for the duration. When the area appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

This spell has additional effects when overlapping with areas of water. Being underwater does not confer resistance against the fire damage dealt by this spell. Also, any underwater areas within the spell's area start bubbling furiously, turning those areas into difficult terrain and causing them to be heavily obscured.

Above water, however, this spell can be difficult to see. A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the area and can see the area must make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check to notice the heat haze caused by this spell, and therefore notice the spell's effect. The DC for this check equals your spell save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bonds of Light

components.m: a strip of paper, covered in holy scripture

entries: You conjure a cord of light, and throw it at a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and is {@condition restrained} for the spell's duration as the cord ensnares it. On a successful save, the cord of light falls to the ground below the target's space.

If the cord is on the ground, a creature within 5 feet can pick it up, if another creature than you picks it up, you can choose for it to take {@damage 1d6} radiant damage and if it is still carrying it at the start of its turn, it takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. As an action, a creature carrying the cord can throw it at a target that it can see within 60 feet.

If you are within 60 feet of the {@condition restrained} target, you can use your action to move it up to 30 feet in a direction of your choice (even vertically), stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface or would move to be more than 60 feet away from you. If the target would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target strikes the other creature and stops moving. When the target strikes something, the target and what it strikes each take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.

To break out, the {@condition restrained} target can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the target escapes and the cord falls to the ground, where it can be picked up and thrown again as described above. Also, the bonds shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that.
A fiend or undead takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage from any instance of damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Call Lightning
entries: A storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the cloud).

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A bolt of lightning flashes down from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to call down lightning in this way again, targeting the same point or a different one.

If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over the existing storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Catnap
entries: You make a calming gesture, and up to six willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range fall {@condition unconscious} for the spell's duration. The spell ends on a target early if it takes damage or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. If a target remains {@condition unconscious} for the full duration, that target can use up to 2 of its Hit Dice as if it completed a short rest, and it can't be affected by this spell again until it finishes a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, each target can expend two additional Hit Dice for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Circle of Smothering

components.m: a small piece of a woolen blanket

entries: You significantly reduce the oxygen content of the air in a 30- foot radius centered on a point you can see within range. Due to the lack of oxygen, any fires within the area near instantly go out, and creatures within the area have resistance to fire damage.

The area is also dangerous for breathing creatures. When a creature starts its turn in the area without holding its breath or if it stops holding its breath in the area for the first time in a round, roll {@dice 6d8}. For each round that the creature has consecutively remained in the area without holding its breath, add a +10 bonus to this roll. If the creature's current hit points are lower than the total, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until it is removed from the area and then damaged or shaken awake. Creatures that don't need to breathe are unaffected by this part of the spell.

When the spell is cast, a creature within the area can use its reaction to begin holding its breath before the air becomes too dangerous to breathe. A creature can also hold its breath before entering the area, as normal, but it is impossible for a creature to start holding its breath inside the area, and it is especially difficult for a creature to hold its breath in the area for long periods. A creature that holds its breath while in the area must maintain its {@status concentration} on doing so, as if it were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the roll increases by {@dice 1d8} and the radius of the area increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Clairvoyance

m.text: a focus worth at least 100 gp, either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing

entries: You create an {@condition invisible} sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The sensor remains in place for the duration, and it can't be attacked or otherwise interacted with.
When you cast the spell, you choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As your action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.
A creature that can see the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from see invisibility or {@sense truesight}) sees a luminous, intangible orb about the size of your fist.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range of this spell increases by 1 mile for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Compulsion
entries: Creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. A target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it can't be {@condition charmed}. On a failed save, a target is affected by this spell.
Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to designate a direction that is horizontal to you.

Each affected target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its next turn. It can take its action before it moves. After moving in this way, it can make another Wisdom saving to try to end the effect.
A target isn't compelled to move into an obviously deadly hazard, such as a fire or pit, but it will provoke opportunity attacks to move in the designated direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range of this spell increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Confession
entries: You present your holy symbol and compel a creature to confess their secrets. Choose a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must truthfully answer the first three questions it is asked.

The affected creature is aware it is under the effects of a spell. While it cannot refuse to answer a question, it may take advantage of any vagueness in a question. For example, if asked "where is your master's fortress?", the creature could respond "on this plane of existence".

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Animals
entries: You summon fey spirits that take the form of beasts and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range.
Choose one of the following options for what appears:
One beast of challenge rating 2 or lower
Two beasts of challenge rating 1 or lower
Three beasts of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
Four beasts of challenge rating 1/4 or lower
Each beast is also considered fey, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The creatures' statistics can be found by using the "All Creatures by Type"-document.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Conjure Barrage

components.m: one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon

entries: You throw a nonmagical weapon or fire a piece of nonmagical ammunition into the air to create a cone of identical weapons that shoot forward and then disappear. Each creature in a 60- foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is the same as that of the weapon or ammunition used as a component.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you starts casting a spell

entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect.

If you readied this spell as an action, and the creature is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.
You can't cast counterspell as a reaction on the same turn you cast another spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Create Food and Water
entries: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of water on the ground or in containers within range, enough to sustain up to fifteen humanoids or five steeds for 24 hours. The food is bland but nourishing, and spoils if uneaten after 24 hours.
The water is clean and doesn't go bad.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can create 45 additional pounds of food and 30 gallons of water for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Creeping Dark
entries: You infuse yourself with dark energies and corporeal shadow, twisting your form into a terrible caricature. Until the spell ends, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and you are heavily obscured. While you are under the effects of this spell, you can move through spaces as small as one square inch without squeezing.

While in this form, you cannot take actions other than the {@action Attack} action. The first time you make an attack, you make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet as you unleash a deadly spike of shadow. On a hit, your target takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage. Once you've done this, or you take radiant damage, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Crusader's Mantle
entries: Holy power radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius, awakening boldness in friendly creatures. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. While in the aura, each non-hostile creature in the aura (including you) deals an extra {@damage 1d4} radiant damage when it hits with a weapon attack. If a creature hits a creature under this effect, they take {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Crushing Singularity
entries: You create an overwhelming gravitational singularity at a point within range. When you cast this spell, any creature within 20 feet of the point must make a Strength saving throw. Each creature that fails the saving throw are moved to the closest available space adjacent to the singularity and takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d6 + 1d6} per creature that failed their saving throw, up to a maximum of {@dice 6d6}.

The area within 20 feet of the singularity counts as difficult terrain. Any creature that ends their turn within 20 feet of the singularity must repeat the Strength saving throw, being pulled towards the singularity and taking {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a failure.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet and maximum damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Crystal Clear
entries: You touch an object of Medium size or smaller or a section of metal no more than 5 feet in any dimension to gain the visual qualities of glass for the duration. You decide how transparent or clear, opaque or diffuse the material becomes, and if it has any color. Although the material may have the appearance of glass, it has the strength of the original material. Lead, gold and platinum cannot be not altered by the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional 5-foot cube for each slot level above 4th. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube.

spell.name: Cyclone Blast
entries: You blast a creature with gale-force winds, dealing damage and knocking it down. One creature you can see within range is affected by the winds. It must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage, is pushed up to 10 feet away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}.
On a success, it takes half as much damage and is neither pushed or knocked down.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Daylight
entries: A 60-foot-radius sphere of light spreads out from a point you choose within range. The sphere is bright light and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet.

If you chose a point on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the light shines from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the affected object with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the light.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of the same level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Deface
entries: You touch a creature's face, forcing its skin to grow shut. If the target has a face it must make a Dexterity saving throw.
On a failure, it cannot use any part of its face as eyes, nose, and mouth are all covered. The target becomes {@condition blinded}, and it cannot breath, smell, or speak.

If the target deals at least 5 damage to itself or allows itself to be damaged for as much on where its eyes, nose, or mouth was, the skin cuts, allowing it to use that part of its face again. If it is takes damage in that way three times, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage needed to remove a part increases by 5 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Detect Interference
entries: You cast your senses out into the universe, seeking to detect the magical emanations of other spellcasters, energies from beyond the Material Plane, or other eldritch powers.

Whenever a creature within 300 feet casts a spell, you are aware of the level of the spell and the school of magic. You are aware of the starting and ending location of any teleportation within 300 feet of you. Whenever a creature that is not native to your current plane enters the range of this spell, you become aware of their plane of origin, general direction, and approximate distance.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 300 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range.

All spells of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Displacing Defense
entries: Your body begins to flicker in and out of existence as shadow magic envelops you. For the duration of the spell, you can use your bonus action to teleport 5 feet. Additionally, when you are targeted by an attack you can use your reaction to attempt to teleport out of harm's way. Roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 11 or higher, the attack automatically misses, and you teleport 5 feet. Otherwise, the attack hits and you teleport 5 feet shortly after.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the distance you can teleport increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Divine Armaments
entries: You draw energy from the positive plane, and shape it into solidified light that forms one of the following sets of equipment:

entries.name: Axes
entries: You form two axes, one in each hand. Each deals {@damage 2d6} radiant damage on a hit, and has the light and thrown properties (range 20/60). If you hit a single target with both axes on the same turn, that target's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Bow
entries: You form a bow in your outstretched hand. The bow magically forms ammunition when you pull back the string, and it deals {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a hit. If has the ammunition (range 150/600) and two-handed properties.

entries.name: Hammer
entries: You form a large hammer in your hands. The hammer deals {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a hit, and has the twohanded property. When you hit a creature with the hammer, you can push that creature up to 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Spear
entries: You form a spear in your hands. The spear deals {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a hit, and has the two-handed property and reach properties.

entries.name: Sword and Shield
entries: You form a sword in one of your hand and a shield in the other. The sword deals {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a hit and has the finesse property. The shield grants +2 AC.

entries.name: Whip
entries: You form a whip in one of your hands. The whip deals {@damage 3d6} radiant damage on a hit and has the finesse and reach property. Whenever you hit a creature with the whip you can pull the target up to 10 feet closer to you.
Anything conjured by this spell lasts for the duration, and you are considered proficient in wielding any conjured equipment.

Also, the equipment sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet beyond that. If you throw or drop a piece of equipment, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause any of the armaments to appear in your hands.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th- level spell slot, the damage increases by an additional die.
When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases by another (2). When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by yet another (3).

spell.name: Divine Note
entries: You let out at a glorious sound which reverberates with the universe. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature that you can see within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} thunder damage. On a miss, you are healed for {@dice 5d8} hit points.
You can also choose to heal yourself for {@dice 5d8} hit points without making an attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both the healing and damage is increased by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Divine Protection
entries: Your faith shields you and up to five allies you can see within range. Each creature gains resistance to all damage until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can choose two additional creatures for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Eldritch Barrier
entries: When you cast this spell, you shield yourself from unnatural energies. You gain advantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions.
Additionally, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and whenever you take damage, you can use your reaction to inflict {@damage 2d12} psychic damage to your attacker.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Elemental Rift

components.m: a pinch of sand from an elemental plane

entries: You pull an elemental from one of the elemental planes for a moment before it disappears back to its native plane. You summon an {@creature air elemental||air}, {@creature earth elemental||earth}, {@creature fire elemental||fire}, or {@creature water elemental}, at a point within range which follows your commands (no action required by you). Once your turn ends, the elemental returns to its native plane.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Elemental Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and imbue it with magic. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For the duration, the weapon has a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits. The +1 bonus does not stack with similar effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the bonus to attack rolls increases to +2 and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d4}. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3 and the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d4}.

spell.name: Embolden

time.condition: which you take when a creature within range that you can see or hear becomes frightened

entries: You call out, reassuring the target of its strength and heroism.
The creature is no longer {@condition frightened} and has advantage on Wisdom saving throws until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level after 3rd.

spell.name: Enemies Abound
entries: You reach into the mind of one creature you can see and force it to make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature automatically succeeds if it is immune to being {@condition frightened}. On a failed save, the target loses the ability to distinguish friend from foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies until the spell ends. Each time the target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Whenever the affected creature chooses another creature as a target, it must choose the target at random from among the creatures it can see within range of the attack, spell, or other ability it's using. If an enemy provokes an opportunity attack from the affected creature, the creature must make that attack if it is able to.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Engulfing Thorns
entries: You conjure thorny vines which grow along a line 5 feet wide and 10 feet long emanating from you in a direction you choose, engulfing everything they touch. At the start of each of your turns, the length of the line increases by 5 feet in the same direction. For the duration, these vines turn the ground in that area to difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} by the vines until the spell ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the vines takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and is pulled 5 feet in the direction that the vines are growing.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the vines can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Entomb
entries: You choose a creature within range to magically construct a coffin around, shutting them inside with overlaying chains.

The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is locked inside and pierced by thousands of spikes, taking {@damage 1d12} piercing damage. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and the spell immediately ends.

At the end of each of its turns it can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success. On a failure it takes an additional {@damage 1d12} piercing damage. While the coffin lasts the creature has total cover but cannot take any actions. The coffin turns to ash when the spell ends.
An undead creature has disadvantage on its saving throws against the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Erupting Earth
entries: Choose a point you can see on the ground within range. A fountain of churned earth and stone erupts in a 20-foot cube centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d12} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, the ground in that area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5-foot-square portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Euphoric Cloud
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of intoxicating blue vapor centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Extreme heat also eliminates the vapors (for example, the heat from a fireball spell).

Creatures that enter the spell's area for the first time on a turn or start their turn there must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is intoxicated by the vapor, becoming {@condition incapacitated}, can speak only falteringly, and is unable to willingly leave the cloud's area.
Constructs, undead and creatures that don't need to breathe are immune to the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Falbryn's Fist

m.text: a steel gauntlet worth 10 gold

entries: A large magical gauntlet envelops your fist, granting you strength but making you unable to wield anything effectively in this hand. When you cast this spell and as an action while the spell lasts, you can choose an option below. While the gauntlet is active your AC is 14 + Dexterity modifier if it wasn't already higher and you can use your spellcasting modifier instead of Strength modifier for Athletic checks. You can only grapple one creature at a time with the gauntlet.

entries.name: Punch
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit the target takes {@damage 3d6} + your spellcasting modifier bludgeoning damage and is {@condition grappled} by you if it is
Large or smaller.

entries.name: Crush
entries: You squeeze a {@condition grappled} creature in your fist. The target takes {@damage 2d6} + your spellcasting modifier bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn or until your grapple ends.

entries.name: Swat
entries: You swat away up to three Medium or smaller creatures within 5 feet of you. The creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and be pushed 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Toss
entries: You raise your hand and toss a creature {@condition grappled} by your fist. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or get thrown an amount of feet equal to five times your spellcasting modifier. A tossed creature takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage, or {@dice 6d6} if it collides with an object or creature that is Small or larger. If you choose to throw it at a creature, that creature can make a Dexterity saving throw, on a failure taking the same damage as the thrown creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fallen Soul
entries: You summon forth an ethereal wraith armed with a deadly blade at a point within range to strike down your foes.

When you cast this spell, and as an action on each of your subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can direct the phantom to fly up to 30 feet and attack a creature within 5 feet of it with its blade. Make a melee spell attack against the creature, with advantage if the creature is {@condition frightened}. On a hit the target takes {@damage 4d10} slashing damage and is {@condition frightened} of it until the end of its next turn.
Additionally, as an action you can teleport the wraith to another unoccupied point within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Facsimile

m.text: an ornate double-sided mirror worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: Throughout the casting, you touch two non-magical items of Small or smaller size (such as a spyglass, hammer, or hempen rope), placing the double-sided mirror between them.
If your touch to either item is broken at any point during the casting, the spell fails, the spell slot is expended, and the material component is consumed.

On a successful casting, you choose which of the two items will be copied. The second item becomes a perfect copy of the original, except for a tiny rune discoverable by an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC.
If the transformed item is broken, forced to change shape, or if dispel magic is successfully cast upon it, it returns to its original form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell using a spell slot of 6th level, you may copy a Medium item. When cast using a spell slot of 9th level, you may copy a Large item. For each size larger than Small, the Material cost is multiplied by

spell.name: Fear

components.m: a white feather or the heart of a hen

entries: You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears.
Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become {@condition frightened} for the duration.

While {@condition frightened} by this spell, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the size of the cone increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Feign Death
entries: You touch a willing creature and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

For the spell's duration, or until you use an action to touch the target and dismiss the spell, the target appears dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated}, and its speed drops to 0. The target has resistance to all damage except psychic damage. If the target is diseased or {@condition poisoned} when you cast the spell, or becomes diseased or {@condition poisoned} while under the spell's effect, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. Each creature must touch at least another targeted creature.

spell.name: Feywalk
entries: You become {@condition invisible} until the start of your next turn.
Anything you are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on your person. Your invisibility ends if you attacks or casts a spell.
Roll a {@dice d20} at the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell. On a roll of 11 or higher, you become {@condition invisible} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4rd level or higher, you can reduce the number you need to roll by 2 for each slot level above 3rd. For example, casting it at 5th level, you only need to roll a 7 or higher.

spell.name: Fireball

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A bright streak flashes from your pointing linger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar

into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 7d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flame Arrows
entries: You touch a quiver containing arrows or bolts. When a target is hit by a ranged weapon attack using a piece of ammunition drawn from the quiver, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage. The spell's magic ends on a piece of ammunition when it hits or misses, and the spell ends when twelve pieces of ammunition have been drawn from the quiver.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can affect two additional pieces of ammunition for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fly

components.m: a wing feather from any bird

entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless It can stop the fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fortune's Favor

m.text: a white pearl worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a willing creature, imparting them with a Fragment

entries.name: of Possibility
entries: This small, floating bead of ethereal energy floats around the creature and lasts for the duration or until expended.

After a creature with a Fragment of Possibility makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, it can expend its fragment to roll an additional {@dice d20} and choose which of the rolls is used. Alternatively, after an attack roll is made against the creature, it can expend its fragment to roll a {@dice d20} and the attack uses the lower of the two.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell grants one additional fragment for every two levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Fox's Fangs
entries: You summon nine illusory blades of light and shadow to swirl behind you. Whenever you could make a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can choose to attack with one of these blades instead. Make a ranged weapon attack or ranged spell attack (your choice) against a target within 60 feet. If you hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and you recover hit points equal to half the damage dealt. After a blade is thrown, it vanishes. Once all nine blades are gone, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you summon an additional blade for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fracture Spirit
entries: When you cast this spell, you fracture your spirit making illusions of yourself appear in thin air. For the duration an illusory double of you spawns every 5 feet that you move, staying in that space but still appearing as if it were you; for example, if you speak, they all seem to speak. When you end your turn under this spell, you can immediately choose one double to swap places with.

A creature with {@sense truesight} sees the illusions and you for the reality, and any creature can make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check as an action against your spell save DC to determine which is the real you, if any, among those it can see. On a success, it knows which is real until you make more doubles. A double dissipates upon being attacked or forced to save or contest an ability check, and all doubles dissipate when the spell ends.

spell.name: Frost Nova
entries: You quickly send out a pulse of freezing cold around you, freezing creatures around you where they stand. All creatures within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Creatures that fail the saving throw have their movement speed reduced by 15 feet until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Gaseous Form

components.m: a bit of gauze and a wisp of smoke

entries: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points.
An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.
While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with.
The target can't attack or cast spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Glimpse
entries: You peer briefly amongst possible immediate futures and direct a possible event to unfold. Roll a {@dice d20}. Once before the end of your next round, you can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with this roll.
You must choose to do so before the roll is made.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can roll an additional die for each slot level above 3rd. You can only choose one die and must choose when the spell is cast.

spell.name: Glossolalia
entries: You utter shrieks of nonsense and gibberish that thinking creatures find distracting and confusing. The spell affects only creatures with Intelligence scores of 5 or higher. Any such creatures within a 30-foot cone must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, on a failure they become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their turn. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 14 or higher make the saving throw with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the size of the cone increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Glyph of Warding

m.text: incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a glyph that later unleashes a magical effect. You inscribe it either on a surface (such as a table or a section of floor or wall) or within an object that can be closed (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest) to conceal the glyph. The glyph can cover an area no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If the surface or object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
The glyph is nearly {@condition invisible} and requires a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC to be found.
You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell.

For glyphs inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or standing on the glyph, removing another object covering the glyph, approaching within a certain distance of the glyph, or manipulating the object on which the glyph is inscribed. For glyphs inscribed within an object, the most common triggers include opening that object, approaching within a certain distance of the object, or seeing or reading the glyph. Once a glyph is triggered, this spell ends.

You can further refine the trigger so the spell activates only under certain circumstances or according to physical characteristics (such as height or weight), creature kind (for example, the ward could be set to affect aberrations or drow), or alignment. You can also set conditions for creatures that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password.
When you inscribe the glyph, choose explosive runes or a spell glyph.

entries.name: Explosive Runes
entries: When triggered, the glyph erupts with magical energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the glyph. The sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage on a failed saving throw (your choice when you create the glyph), or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spell Glyph
entries: You can store a prepared spell of 3rd level or lower in the glyph by casting it as part of creating the glyph.
The spell must target a single creature or an area. The spell being stored has no immediate effect when cast in this way.

When the glyph is triggered, the stored spell is cast. If the spell has a target, it targets the creature that triggered the glyph. If the spell affects an area, the area is centered on that creature. If the spell summons hostile creatures or creates harmful objects or traps, they appear as close as possible to the intruder and attack it. If the spell requires {@status concentration}, it lasts until the end of its full duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of an explosive runes glyph increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd. If you create a spell glyph, you can store any spell of up to the same levet as the slot you use for the glyph of warding.

spell.name: Grasp of the Wind
entries: You call upon the wind to aid you, and let it guide your strikes. Each Large or smaller creature you choose within range and line of sight must make a Strength saving throw.

On a failure, they are pushed as close to you as possible in a straight line towards you. When you cast this spell, you also take the {@action Attack} action after pushing your enemies closer. All melee attacks are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above the 3rd.

spell.name: Hand of Hadar
entries: You form a connection between realms, designating a creature as a host vessel for a fraction of eldritch power.

Choose one willing creature within range, which grows a great, milky tentacle. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to manipulate the tentacle, lashing out at one creature within 10 feet of the host. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Haste
entries: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, Disengage, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.
When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Healing Spirit
entries: You call forth a nature spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot cube you can see within range. The spirit looks like a transparent beast or fey (your choice).
Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to restore {@dice 1d6} hit points to any creature in the spirits space. The spirit can't heal constructs or undead.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Hunger of Hadar
entries: You open a gateway to the dark between the stars, a region infested with unknown horrors. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point with range and lasting for the duration. This void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises that can be heard up to 30 feet away. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are {@condition blinded}.

The void creates a warp in the fabric of space, and the area is difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage as milky, otherworldly tentacles rub against it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both instances of damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern

components.m: a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material

entries: You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Roll {@dice 12d10}; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring {@condition unconscious} creatures). The affected creature becomes {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, roll an additional {@dice 6d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Immortal Phalanx
entries: As an action, you can call forth fallen spectral soldiers to form a line of spears within 15 feet of you. The line is 10 feet long, 30 feet wide, and 5 feet tall. The side pointing away from you is the front. Creatures which pass through the front take {@damage 2d6} piercing damage for every 5 feet moved within the area and count the area as difficult terrain.
While {@status concentration||concentrating} on the spell, you can spend an action to reposition the line to within 15 feet of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Iron Wave Slash
entries: You flourish the weapon used in the casting and then vanish to slash like the waves. Choose up to two creatures in a line extending 30 feet from you. As part of the casting of this spell, make a melee attack against each target with the weapon used in the casting. On each hit, the target takes additional slashing damage equal to {@dice 2d10}.
You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the length of the line increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Irreversible Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, cruel shadows creep down your weapon and into your target's wounds. The attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, its flesh festers and refuses to repair. Until the spell ends, the target cannot regain hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Last Word
entries: You relive the last moments of a once-living creature whose corpse you touch when you cast the spell. You experience the last 10 minutes of its life through the creature's eyes.

While you are experiencing these moments, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your physical surroundings. If you lose {@status concentration} on the spell, it ends early and you lose any viewings you may have missed. You can end the spell early with a bonus action. This spell does not affect dead creatures currently animated by magic, or creatures that have been dead for more than 1 month.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you see the last 30 minutes of the creature's life.

spell.name: Leap of Faith
entries: With a prayer you dash towards a damaged ally that you can see within range while stretching out your hand. Opportunity attacks provoked by this movement are made with disadvantage.
When you reach them, the target regain a number of hit points equal to {@dice 3d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier and you can have them stand up if they are {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
entries: A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell ends if you leave its area.

Nine creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than nine creatures. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside.
Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is opaque from the outside, of any color you choose, but it is transparent from the inside.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the hemisphere increases by 5 feet each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Life Link

m.text: a rusted iron ring worth at least 10 gp

entries: You reach out and snatch a creature you can see within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} by you (escape DC equal to your spell save DC). While you are grappling the target, you have resistance to all damage, and each time you take damage the target takes the same amount of damage.
The spell ends if the grapple ends or if the target dies.

spell.name: Life Transference
entries: You sacrifice some of your health to mend another creature's injuries. You take {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, and one creature of your choice that you can see within range regains a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage you take.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Lightning Arrow
entries: As part of casting this spell you take the {@action Attack} action with a ranged or thrown weapon, as you channel lightning into the weapon's ammunition, or the weapon itself if it's a thrown weapon. The first attack you make deals lightning damage instead of the weapon's regular damage and you deal an additional {@damage 2d8} lightning damage.

Whether you hit or miss the first attack, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Each of these creatures takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage for both effects of the spell increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Lightning Bolt

components.m: a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass

entries: A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Liliander's Hellspear
entries: You summon a {@condition burning|HA:GS} incorporeal spear and launch it towards a target with range. Make a ranged spell attack against that target. If there are any creatures 10 feet or less directly behind the target you in a line and the attack roll would also hit them, they are also hit. On a hit, a creature takes {@damage 5d10} fire damage.
Additionally, their speed drops to 0 until the start of your next turn, when the spear dissipates.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Looking Glass
entries: You touch a window and can see out of the outside or inside of any other window in the building it is attached to. You can only look from one window at a time, and can change to another window as an action. You gain no ability to hear or otherwise sense what you can see.
A creature with {@sense truesight} or under the effects of a see invisibility spell sees your eyes looking out from a window you are viewing from.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 4th level or higher, another creature touching you can see through this ability as well, one creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Luring Light

components.m: the tooth of an aquatic predator

entries: You create a lure of light at a point you can see within range while making yourself {@condition invisible}. This lure creates bright light in a 5-foot radius around itself, and moves with you.

Whenever a hostile creature within 90 feet of the lure, sees it for the first time, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it must use all of its movement during its turns traveling towards the lure by the safest route possible.

A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} is immune to this effect. Each time the target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature reaches the lure, a predatory phantasm to lash out and bite the creature. The target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or suffer {@damage 4d10} piercing damage.
