Once this happens, or if you attack or cast another spell, this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the piercing damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Circle

m.text: holy water or powdered silver and iron worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall cylinder of magical energy centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range. Glowing runes appear wherever the cylinder intersects with the floor or other surface.
Choose one or more of the following types of creatures: celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead. The circle affects a creature of the chosen type in the following ways:
The creature can't willingly enter the cylinder by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to do so, it must first succeed on a Charisma saving throw.
The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets within the cylinder.
Targets within the cylinder can't be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by the creature.

When you cast this spell, you can elect to cause its magic to operate in the reverse direction, preventing a creature of the specified type from leaving the cylinder and protecting targets outside it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Major Image
entries: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or cold to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal thunder damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a troglodyte's stench).

As long as you are within range of the illusion, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your {@status concentration}.

spell.name: Mass Healing Word
entries: As you call out words of restoration, up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Melf's Minute Meteors

components.m: niter, sulfur, and pine tar formed into a bead

entries: You create six tiny meteors in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spell's duration. When you cast the spell

—and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter—you can expend one or two of the meteors, sending them streaking toward a point or points you choose within 120 feet of you. Once a meteor reaches its destination or impacts against a solid surface, the meteor explodes. Each creature within 5 feet of the point where the meteor explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of meteors created increases by two for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Meld into Stone
entries: You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the stone for the duration. Using your movement, you step into the stone at a point you can touch.
Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use your movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals 50 bludgeoning damage to you. If expelled, you fall {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered.

spell.name: Mushroom Ring

m.text: faerie dust and mushroom spores, which the spell consumes

entries: Choose a point that you can see within range, you enhance the fecundity in a 10-foot radius, as dimly glowing mushrooms sprout from the ground around the edges of the circle.
When you cast the spell, choose one of the following: beasts, humanoids, or monstrosities. The ring affects a creature of the chosen type in the following ways:
The creature attempting to enter the dome must first succeed on a Charisma saving throw.
The creature has disadvantage on attacks against targets within the area.
Creatures within the cylinder can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by the creature.
While the ring exists, you can invite (no action required) creatures of the chosen type to ignore the spell's effects.

You can use your action to consume the ring in an explosion of spores, ending the spell. When you do, creatures other than you and those you have invited within 5 feet of the ring's circumference must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Nature's Grasp
entries: When you cast this spell, a mass of vines springs forth from your arm. When you cast this spell, and as an action on each of your turns while it remains, you can make a melee spell attack against a target you can see within 30 feet of you. If you hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage and is lifted 5 feet into the air and it can't make opportunity attacks until the start of its next turn.
They can spend half their movement during their turn to free themselves of the vines, returning to the ground.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Nondetection

m.text: a pinch of diamond dust worth 25 gp sprinkled over the target, which the spell consumes

entries: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from divination magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension.
The target can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. Each creature must touch at least another targeted creature.

spell.name: Pathfinder
entries: You summon a spirit in the form of a bird of prey and command it to charge ahead. It covers a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You see everything on its path, remembering it as if you had seen it personally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Perplex
entries: Designate a creature you can see within range, which makes a Intelligence saving throw. A creature with an Intelligence score of 2 or lower can't be affected by this spell. On a failure, the target rolls a {@dice d6} at the start of its turn, taking the amount rolled as psychic damage, and subtracting that number from attack rolls, ability checks, and {@status concentration} saving throws.
The target can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Phantom Steed
entries: A Large quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, but it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The creature uses the statistics below. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the steed takes any damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional mount for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Pillars of Winter
entries: You cause moisture in the air to condense into up to 2 icy pillars within range, or 3 if you are in a snowstorm. Each pillar is a cylinder that has a diameter of 5 feet and a height of up to 15 feet, and they are conjured floating 15 feet above the ground.
At the start of your next turn, the pillars fall to the ground.

If a pillar falls onto a creature of size Medium or smaller, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, and is {@condition restrained}, pinched between the pillar and the ground. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and must move 5 feet in any horizontal direction or fail the save automatically. A {@condition restrained} creature who could move 5 feet can make a Strength or Dexterity check (their choice) as an action against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and must move from under the pillar.

Once the pillars fall, you can use your bonus action to cause one or more of the pillars to shatter. Each creature within 5 feet of the shattered pillar must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} cold damage and {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature was being {@condition restrained} by the pillar when it shattered, they are no longer {@condition restrained}.
If you maintain your {@status concentration} on this spell for its full duration, the pillars become permanent and can't be dispelled. Otherwise, they fade when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you create one additional pillar for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Pincushion
entries: You change one object or creature of Small or larger size to magically attract physical projectiles that pass near it. If the target is a creature, you must make a melee spell attack to touch the creature. Any ranged attack that fires a physical projectile towards another creature or point within 15 feet of the affected creature or object is made with disadvantage. If the attack misses it automatically hits the affected creature or object. Any ranged weapon attack aimed at the target is made with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: Phantom Steed
entries: Large beast, unaligned

entriesHigherLevel.name: Speed 100ft.
entries: STR DEX CON INT WIS CHA
Senses passive {@skill Perception} 10

entriesHigherLevel.name: Languages -
entries: Challenge 1/4 (50 XP)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Tireless
entries: A phantom steed can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Hooves
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Plant Growth
entries: This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area.
There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range increases by 100 feet or half-mile for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Protection from Energy
entries: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Pulse Wave
entries: You push out both your hands in front of you and pull them to a side or back towards you, creating a rushing line of intense pressure in a 20-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Every creature that fails the save is pushed to a side of the cube (your choice), depending on the choice you made when casting the spell.
In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the cone are likewise pulled or pushed 15 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the distance pulled or pushed increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Radiant Burst
entries: You emit an intense light, searing nearby enemies. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 3d12} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Fiends and undead make the saving throw with disadvantage and are {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn on a failure.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rain of Spiders
entries: A vertical column of spiders begins to rain down in a location you specify. Each creature that starts its turn within the 20- foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A {@creature swarm of spiders} descends onto each creature within the cylinder. On a failed save, the swarm has full hit points (22). On a successful save, the swarm has half hit points (11).

The swarm is considered to be climbing on the target creature and moves with them, even if they the affected area, and takes its turn immediately after that creatures turn. A creature can make use of its action to attempt to get them off, making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check against your spell save DC. The swarm will attack the creature it fell on it if can, or move to chase them if it has been knocked off.

If a creature already swarmed by spiders starts their turn in the area of effect, they repeat the saving throw. The swarm on that creature gains 22 hit point and maximum hit points on a failed save, or 11 current and maximum hit points on a success. The swarm's hit points cannot go above 22 for a Medium creature, 44 for a Large, 88 for Huge, and so on.
Any spiders that remain when the spell ends disappear after {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 10 feet and the height by 20 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Raise the Field
entries: You animate the corpses of those buried underneath your feet. Choose up to eight points that are on the ground that are in range. A grave zombie emerges half way out of the ground at each point, animated with a foul imitation of life.
These zombies are hostile to all creatures. Roll initiative for the raised zombies as a group. The zombies attack the nearest non-undead to the best of their ability.
When the spell ends, all the zombies burrow back underground and disappear.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher, you can summon four additional zombies for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rejection
entries: You touch a creature and remove a fraction of its free will, forcing it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is unaffected by spells that require the target to be willing, regardless of whether the target is actually willing or not.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. Each creature after the first, must be within 30 feet of the first.

spell.name: Remove Curse
entries: You try to break a curse affecting a creature or object you touch, initiating a cursebreaking challenge.
If a spirit inhabits an item, it is unaffected and you need the banishment spell to initiate a cursebreaking challenge.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you gain +1 to the cursebreaking roll for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Resonance
entries: You sing to disrupt the inherent order within the ground around you. Choose a 10-foot square within range, creatures within that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 2d10} thunder damage become {@condition restrained} as they sink into the ground as it softens and rehardens.
At the end of each round, the target can make a Strength saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
Until the spell ends you can use an action to repeat this process, choosing a different 10-foot square each time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Revivify

m.text: diamonds worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute.

Roll a {@dice d20} and add your spellcasting modifier, the DC to beat equals 10 + 1 for each previous successful resurrection the character has undergone. If successful that creature returns to life with 1 hit point. If you fail, you need to cast a non-rapid resurrection spell (like reincarnate or resurrection) to able to try and revive them.
This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, on a successful resurrection you heal the creature for {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rewind

time.condition: when a creature ends its turn

entries: Using your reaction, you can cause a Medium or smaller creature to return to the space they occupied at the start of the turn. Select a creature that you can see within range, forcing them to make a Charisma saving throw or be teleported back to the spot they ended their previous turn on (6 seconds prior). If the space the target would be teleported into is occupied by another creature or object, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sending

components.m: a short piece of fine copper wire

entries: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.
You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both you and the target can reply one additional time for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Serpent's Bite
entries: Massive, venomous fangs spring from your mouth. As part of casting this spell and as an action on each of your turn while the spell lasts, you can make a melee spell attack against a target within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} poison damage and are {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shadow Toxin
entries: You fling a thin needle of darkness at a creature you can see within range, injecting them with corruptive magic that taints their mind and fills them with doubt. Whenever the target attempts to cast a spell that targets a creature friendly to them, they must make an Intelligence saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage, their spellcasting fails and the spell is lost. If they succeed, the corruptive magic is broken and the target is freed from the effects of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can choose one additional target for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shape Wood
entries: You touch a nonmagical wooden object no larger than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. For example, you might shape a trapdoor into a chair, spear, or shield, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a wooden door or its frame to seal the door shut.
The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the object can be 5 feet larger in every dimension for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Silencing Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon pierces your opponent's psyche, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} psychic damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to speak until the spell ends. While the spell lasts, it is impossible for the target to cast a spell that includes a verbal component.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Siren's Song
entries: You sing a magical melody, attracting creatures to you. Each humanoid or giant within the spell's range that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. On your subsequent turns, you must use a bonus action to continue singing and you can't use your voice for anything else, otherwise the spell ends.

While {@condition charmed} by you, a target is {@condition incapacitated}, and while it is more than 5 feet away from you, it must move on its turn toward you by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but avoids moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit.
At the end of its turns, it is in combat, it can repeat the saving throw and if it takes damage it can repeat the saving throw with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range increases by 150 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Skewering Branch
entries: You cause a thick branch to shoot out of the ground along a line 5 feet wide and 30 feet long. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pushed along the length of the branch as it grows in a direction of your choice. If the branch impacts a hard surface, such as a wall, it immediately stops and skewers all creatures that were pushed against that wall. Each creature takes {@damage 3d4} piercing damage and is {@condition restrained}, skewered to the surface. If a creature can't be pushed against the wall, as other creatures are taking up the space, it is moved as close as possible to the wall.

A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (the creature's choice) against the spell's save DC, ending the effect on a success. On a failed check, a creature takes an additional {@damage 3d4} piercing damage.
When the spell ends, the conjured branch breaks and wilts away.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both instances of damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sleet Storm

components.m: a pinch of dust and a few drops of water

entries: Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot- tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone}.

If a creature starts its turn in the spell's area and is {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or lose {@status concentration}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, each dimension of the cylinder increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Slow
entries: You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.
An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions.
On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, increase the dimension of the cube by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Soaring Vines

time.condition: which you take when you are falling and are within 30 feet of plants or a solid surface

components.m: a limb, root, vine, or other length of plant material

entries: Vines magically sprout from a solid surface (such as the ground or a wall) or plants within 30 feet of you and wrap themselves securely around your torso, leaving your arms and legs unhindered. The vines shift with you, growing and retracting as you move from plant to plant or along the ground or other surface, and if any of the vines are destroyed, they are immediately and seamlessly replace by more vines.
If you cast this spell as a reaction, the vines catch you where you are, stopping your fall, and you take no falling damage.

For the duration, as long as you are within 30 feet of a solid surface or plants, you have a flying speed of 40 feet, which can't be reduced by nonmagical means. In addition, you can't be knocked {@condition prone}, and you have advantage on saving throws made against effects that would push you or pull you. When the spell ends, the vines greatly lower you back to the ground if you are aloft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels:
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th lever or higher, the duration is {@status concentration}, up to 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the duration is 7 days. Using a spell slot of 7th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require {@status concentration}.

spell.name: Speak with Dead
entries: You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can ask three additional questions for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Speak with Plants
entries: You imbue plants within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question plants about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

You can also turn difficult terrain caused by plant growth (such as thickets and undergrowth) into ordinary terrain that lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where plants are present into difficult terrain that lasts for the duration, causing vines and branches to hinder pursuers, for example.

Plants might be able to perform other tasks on your behalf, at the DM's discretion. The spell doesn't enable plants to uproot themselves and move about, but they can freely move branches, tendrils, and stalks. If a plant creature is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language, but you gain no magical ability to influence it.
This spell can cause the plants created by the entangle spell to release a {@condition restrained} creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 15 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spellsteal
entries: You touch a creature. A spell of 1st level or lower on the target ends, and you gain the spell's effects for 1 minute. If the target is under several effects, one is chosen at random, unless you know the name of the spell you want to steal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell level that you can affect increases by one level for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spineback
entries: You sprout foot-long spines along your back, which regrows until the spell ends. As part of casting this spell and as an action on each of your turn while the spell lasts, you can fire these spines at a target within 60 feet of you. It must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 6d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Additionally, until the spell ends, you can deal {@damage 2d6} piercing damage to any creature grappling you at the start of each of your turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spirit Guardians
entries: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spray of Thorns
entries: You shoot forth a burst of thorns from your hands which pierce through your enemy's defenses, making them vulnerable to attacks. Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 8d4} piercing damage, and until the start of your next turn they take an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage whenever they are hit by a weapon attack. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and suffers no other effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Stench Spray
entries: You spray a jet of foul-smelling liquid. Each creature in a 15- foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or be coated in the foul-smelling substance. A coated creature is {@condition poisoned} as long as the spell lasts. Additionally, each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a coated creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. Creatures that don't need to breathe automatically succeed on this saving throw, while a creature with the Keen
Smell trait makes the saving throws with disadvantage.
A creature can remove the stench on itself by using 15 minutes to bathe in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the size of the cone increases by 5 feet for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Stinking Cloud

components.m: a rotten egg or several skunk cabbage leaves

entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration.

Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.
A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the spell increases by 5 feet for every 2 slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Summon Lesser Demons

components.m: a vial of blood from a humanoid killed within the past 24 hours

entries: You utter foul words, summoning demons from the chaos of the Abyss. Roll on the following table to determine what appears.

rows: Two demons of challenge rating 1 or lower
Three demons of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
Four demons of challenge rating 1/4 or lower

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, you summon twice as many demons. If you cast it using a spell slot of 8th or 9th level, you summon three times as many demons.

spell.name: Sundering Smite
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, your weapon thrums with destructive power, and the attacks deals an extra {@damage 3d8} acid damage to the target. Objects and structures take double damage from the attack.
If the target was a creature, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, you can destroy a nonmagical object of your choice that the creature is wearing or carrying.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tap Telepathy
entries: You can overhear the telepathic conversations of other creatures within 120 feet of you, and the contents of any message or sending spells cast in the same area. You do not detect the uncommunicated thoughts of creatures, nor do you understand telepathic conversations spoken in a language you don't know.

In an area where numerous telepathic conversations are occurring at the same time, you must specify the specific creatures whose transmissions you wish to overhear, up to a number equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum: 2).
Telepathy tap does not allow you to overhear the telepathic conversations of creatures protected by a mind blank spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range increases by 60 feet each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Third Hand
entries: A strong but dexterous prehensile tail grows out from above your behind, or if you already have one, it strengthens. You can use it in the following ways.

Your tail is a natural melee weapon, with which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d10} + your spellcasting modifier. If the creature is Medium or smaller, you can choose to make it {@condition prone} instead of dealing damage.
You can use it to grapple, using your spellcasting modifier
+ proficiency modifier versus the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}). You can do this even if you have no empty hand.
You have advantage on all Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks and Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb.

It can lift, hold, push, and pull objects that weigh up to 10 times your spellcasting modifier. You can use it to wear a one-handed weapon or shield, following the same rules as regular two-weapon fighting if you are wielding another weapon in some way. It can't be used for finer manipulations.
It can be used to take a second use an object action on your turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell

spell.name: Thunder Step
entries: You teleport yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Immediately after you disappear, a thunderous boom sounds, and each creature within 10 feet of the space you left must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The thunder can be heard from up to 300 feet away.

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also teleport one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell, and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Thunderbolts
entries: You spawn three thunderbolts in your hand, jumping and humming with electricity and power. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you can throw one bolt by making a ranged spell attack on one creature within 120 feet. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} lightning damage. Whether the attack hits or misses, the bolt disappears. You can forgo one of the {@dice d8}'s on a hit to knock the creature {@condition prone} if it is Large or smaller.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you create an additional thunderbolt for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Thunderous Bellow
entries: You shout a thunderous phrase that bursts outward from your location. Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure a creature takes {@damage 5d8} thunder damage, is {@condition deafened}, and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is not {@condition deafened} or knocked {@condition prone}.
The spell can be heard from out to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tidal Wave
entries: You conjure up a wave of water that crashes down on an area within range. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 30 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tides of Blood
entries: You draw out your own blood as well as the blood of corpses within 20 feet of you. You may choose to expend a number of hit points, and you may also gain the hit points needed from corpses within the radius. Each corpse that had a hit point maximum greater than or equal to 5 in life gives 5 hit points towards the casting of this spell, and then cannot be used to cast this spell again.
As a bonus action on your next turn, you release the blood.

Each creature within 20 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 4d6} + the number of hit points spent as necrotic damage. On a success, they take half damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tiny Servant
entries: You touch one Tiny, nonmagical object that isn't attached to another object or a surface and isn't being carried by another creature. The target animates and sprouts little arms and legs, becoming a creature under your control until the spell ends or the creature drops to 0 hit points. See the stat block for its statistics.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command the creature if it is within 120 feet of you. (If you control multiple creatures with this spell, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same comumand to each one.)

You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a simple, general command, such as to fetch a key, stand watch, or stack some books. If you issue no commands, the servant does nothing other than defend itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the servant continues to follow that order until its task is complete.
When the creature drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tongues

components.m: a small clay model of a ziggurat

entries: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. Each creature must touch at least another targeted creature.

spell.name: Toxic Tongue
entries: Your tongue lengthens and secretes a virulent poison for the duration. You can use this spell in the following ways:

entries.name: Spit Poison
entries: As an action, you can spray a stream of poison from your mouth, targeting one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Poison Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you lick across a melee weapon or piece of ammunition you are holding or carried by a willing creature within 5 feet of you. The poison's potency until the start of your next turn or until you've struck a creature. If a creature is hit by the {@condition poisoned} weapon or ammunition, it takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of your poisons increase by an additional damage die for each slot level above

spell.name: Tracking Dart
entries: Choose a creature you have seen within the last minute. You shoot a dart of light towards it, which travels 2 feet above the ground, rounding corners, and climbing walls while taking the quickest route. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d10} force damage.
If the target is out of range, it travels as far as it can before sizzling out.
The missile leaves a glowing trail that lasts until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Transfer Object

m.text: a carrier pigeon capsule made of gold worth 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You hold the capsule in your hand as you touch a loose object no larger than 2 feet in any dimension, such as a pouch (filled with gold), a pillow, or a jeweled dagger. You can then name a living creature you have met and seen at least once before, or any creature for which you possess a body part, lock of hair, clipping from a nail, or similar portion of the creature's body.

The item then disappears and reappears adjacent to the target creature. If the target creature is on another plane, or if it is proofed against magical detection or location, the item doesn't disappear but the spell slot is wasted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using an 7th- level spell slot, you can send the item to a creature on a different plane of existence from you.

spell.name: Transposition
entries: You swap the positions of two creatures of the same size (Medium and Small counts as the same) that you can see within range. If a creature is unwilling, it can make a Charisma saving throw to resist being teleported. If either creature succeeds, the spell is lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. As long as two creatures fail their save, the spell succeeds.

spell.name: Umbral Form
entries: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into an animated shadow for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a walking and climbing speed of 30 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains stuck to the ground even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.
While in the shadowy form, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with.
The target can't attack or cast spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. Each creature must touch at least another targeted creature.

spell.name: Unblinking Vigil

components.m: a strand of your own hair

entries: You carve a mark into the forehead of an undead creature that is under your control. As long as you are within a 1-mile of the creature, the marks allows you to transfer your consciousness to the creature as an action. While controlling it, you gain the benefits of any special senses possessed by the undead creature, though you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own senses.

You can have multiple creatures under this effect at the same time and you can move your consciousness between any of them as an action. If an undead is killed whilst you are controlling it, you take {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Vampiric Touch
entries: The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wall of Sand
entries: You create a wall of swirling sand on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick, and it vanishes when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is {@condition blinded} while in the walls space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum length of the wall increases by 15 feet and the maximum height and thickness increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wall of Water
entries: You create a wall of water on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can make a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall vanishes when the spell ends. The wall's space is difficult terrain.
Any ranged weapon attack that enters the walls space has disadvantage on the attack roll, and fire damage is halved if the fire effect passes through the wall to reach its target.

Spells that deal cold damage that pass through the wall cause the area of the wall they pass through to freeze solid (at least a 5-foot-square section is frozen). Each 5-foot—square frozen section has AC 5 and 15 hit points. Reducing a frozen section to 0 hit points destroys it. When a section is destroyed, the walls water doesn't fill it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum length of the wall increases by 15 feet, the maximum height increases by 5 feet, and the maximum diameter increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Watcher

m.text: owl feather and a crystal eye worth 10 gp

entries: You create an {@condition invisible} sensor within range, when you do so, determine a triggering circumstance. The sensor remains in place for the duration, and it can't be attacked or otherwise interacted with. The sensor will lay dormant in the area where it was created until a specified triggering circumstance occurs or it is dispelled. The triggering circumstances can be as general or specific as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 60 feet of the sensor.

When the specified triggering circumstance occurs and if you're within 1 mile of the sensor, the spell will notify you telepathically the trigger has occurred, and you may choose to concentrate on the sensor to hear and see the area for 1 minute as if you were in the sensor's space. After 1 minute or if you lose {@status concentration}, the spell ends. While {@status concentration||concentrating} on the sensor, you are deaf and blind to your own surroundings. If you're further than 1 mile from the sensor or on another plane when the triggering circumstance occurs, you don't receive any information and the spell ends. A creature that can see the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from see invisibility or {@sense truesight}) sees a luminous, intangible orb about the size of your fist.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range and distance that triggers the sensor increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Water Breathing

components.m: a short reed or piece of straw

entries: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target three additional creatures for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Water Walk
entries: This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surfacesuch as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava-as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration.
If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface of the liquid at a rate of 60 feet per round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, its duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Whirling Wards

components.m: a tiny shield made of glass

entries: You create three translucent shimmering shields that appear in your space and whirl around you for the duration. When you are targeted by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to interpose one of the shields. If the attack hits, the shield takes the damage instead of you. A shield can absorb 15 damage. If the shield takes more damage than it can absorb, you take any overflow damage. Once you use a shield in this way and the shield is hit by an attack, it shatters. Once you use the last shield, the spell ends.

If the shield takes all damage you don't have to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status concentration}. If there is some excess damage that you take, you make the saving throw with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional shield for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wild Flight
entries: You double your remaining movement speed and your body becomes a swirling orb of magical energy until the end of your turn. While in this form you cannot take any other action than movement, but you can move freely through creatures.
Your velocity so high that you can only change direction every 10 feet.

Each creature you move through must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If a Large creature or bigger creatures fails their saving throw, add an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each 5 feet they occupy that you moved through. A creature can only be damaged once by each casting of wild flight.
If you end your turn in an occupied space, you must succeed a Dexterity saving throw. If you fail, you take {@damage 2d6} force damage and reappear {@condition prone} in the nearest available space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wind Wall

components.m: a tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin

entries: A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay.

Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.)
Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum length of the wall increases by 25 feet for each slot level above 3rd.
